Astenia al igual que su esposo se dedica a ser agricultor y alquila una pequeña parcela donde cultiva los granos básicos de la zona como lo son maíz y frijol y a su vez cultiva loroco.  La cliente desea en estas próximas cosechas tener más ganancias es por esa razón que solicita  INTEGRAL un préstamo el cual le permita comprar insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas entre otros; Y a su vez pagar el alquiler de la parcela ya que no cuenta con otros  ingresos y esto es lo único que sabe realizar. Espera que la ayuda solicitada llegue así en su hogar no faltara el pan de cada día.
texts.en: Astenia, 33, lives with her family.  She owns the house where she lives and is known to be hard-working.  She takes care of the family home and also helps her husband with his work.  Astenia and her husband are farmers.  They rent a small plot where they grow grains--maize, beans and locoro--common to this area.  Astenia is applying for an INTEGRAL loan, part of which she will use to buy supplies--seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicides, etc.-- for the business and the rest to pay the rent on the plot of land that they farm.  Farming is all Astenia knows how to do and she hopes the investment will increase the size of her crop and, in turn, her income. Her family has no other source of income and she needs the loan to make sure they can continue to provide for themselves.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, etc. for her farming business.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose de 49 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. José desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jose, 49, is known to be a responsible man who has always taken care of his family.  He lives with his wife and children.  He operates a farming business, work that he has long carried out with enthusiasm and good humor.  He has, for many years, grown the basic grains--maize and beans--that are most common to this area.  Jose wants to increase his sales and he is applying for an INTEGRAL loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, etc.--to grow his business.  He has no other source of income and is counting on the loan so that he can continue farming and providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, etc. for his farming business.

loans.name: Guliver

texts.en: Guliver is 60-years-old man. He is married and lives with his large family in the Chkhorotsku district.  He has wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Each member of the family gets monthly IDP assistance from the government institutions as they are persecuted. Guliver has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family has 2 hectares of agricultural land, where 1200 nut trees are grown. They sell the harvested nuts locally. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the requested loan, Guliver wants to open a Georgian bread bakery. He owns a commercial space and will buy all the needed equipment. Guliver will bake the Georgian bread himself.  Guliver hopes the business will be profitable, as the location is very populous. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of his family and Guliver will be able to provide for his children’s education in the future.

loans.use: to open a Georgian bread bakery

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 34-years-old person, married with two children. She lives together with her husband in Samburu, Kenya where they stay in their own building with electric power and tap water. She has a retail shop.
She has approached for a loan amountinfg to KES 25000 to buy sacks of maize flour, bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize flour, bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 48 years old and supports four members of her family. She has been selling clothes for about 11 years, with an income of approximately 31,200 KES a month. This is her fourth loan with KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use the loan to buy more new clothes for sale. She hopes to be a leading boutique owner.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en: Macaria is 47 years old, married and has six children. To gain income, she sells beauty products to the people in her village. She has been in her business for over five years now and earns about P5,000 each month selling these items. She would like to increase sales, and that is why she is asking for a loan of P13,000 to buy cosmetics, perfumes and soap to sell. This will help increase sales and profits as well. Additional revenue will be used for education expenses.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, cosmetics, perfumes and soap to sell

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is from Iraq. He is 35 years old and single. Fouad lives with his parents and he is the only provider of the family. Fouad owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2012, and now he has an employee. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Fouad is requesting a sum of $1,200 to buy a motor generator and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has five children. Raed is the only provider of the family.

Raed owns a small grocery store, where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2008. He built good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Raed is requesting a USD 1,500 loan to install a modern display window in his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his children with better life conditions.

loans.use: to install a modern display window in his shop.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 29-year-old single youth client from Iraq. He lives with four family members, one of whom is employed. Raed works as a barber and he established his own business in 2008 after working for over three years to gain experience. He has one employee and has built an excellent reputation in his surrounding area.

Raed is requesting a 1,800 USD youth loan to install a second ceiling and purchase some equipment. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and increase his profits to have a good future.

loans.use: to install a second ceiling and purchase equipment

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is a 27-year-old youth client from Iraq. He is married with three children and is the sole provider for his family. Yahya owns a small grocery store where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergent, and snacks. He established his business in 2006 and has an employee. Yahya has gained good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.

Yahya is requesting an 1,800 USD youth loan to renovate his grocery store. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and increase his profits to provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old, married to Deborah, and they are blessed with three children. Daniel is a carpenter. He has been in this business for the last five years and gets an income of KES 20,000 per month.

Daniel has got a good credit history with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) and he is applying for his second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET which he plans to use to buy raw materials, like timber. 

He will use the extra profit to expand his business and to educate his children. He hopes to further expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for his business, like timber.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El sr. Juan de 45 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de el. El trabaja como policía municipal para la alcaldía desde hace 1 año como fijo y tenia 4 años de trabajar como contratado. El cliente es el sustento de su hogar ya que en su casa es el único que trabaja, sus hijos estudian y su esposa es quien se encarga de las tareas de la casa.  Solicita este nuevo crédito para la construcción de un muro ya que su casa queda en una loma y necesita construir este muro para evitar que la construcción se vea en riesgo de deteriorarse.
texts.en: Juan, 45, has three dependent children; his wife’s a housewife.  He’s been working as a permanent municipal police officer for the city for a year but had already worked for four years as a contracted employee.  He has supported his home since he’s the only one that works; his children are in school and his wife takes care of the household chores.  He’s asking for this new loan to build a wall because his house is on a hillside and he needs to build this wall to keep the house safe from damage.

loans.use: to buy building supplies like concrete blocks, cement, sand, rebar and gravel.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Mariée à une couturière et âgé de 38ans, mr Yaovi est père 02 enfants tous à l'école âgés de 06 et 04ans. Il a appris la menuiserie et fabrique des chaises, des lits et des armoires qu’il vend à toutes personne. Son activité se fait dans un atelier et il fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter du bois. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il voudrait ouvrir d’autres ateliers et créer un centre de formation. Avec les profits, il espère assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en: Mr Yaovi is 38 years old, married to a seamstress and the father of two children aged 6 and 4 years, both of whom attend school. He learned how to be a carpetner and makes chairs, bed frames and dressers whom he sells to a number of customers. This activity is conducted in a workshop. He is asking for his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase wood. He hopes to someday open other workshops and establish a training center. He will use the profits to ensure the needs of his family.

loans.use: purchase wood

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is 29 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in Samburu, Kenya. Mwaka is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a general store. 

Mwaka is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy shampoo, detergent, and sacks of sugar. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, detergent, and sacks of sugar

loans.name: Ahsan

texts.en:
Ahsan is a 23-year-old single youth client. He lives in Iraq and has two brothers. Ahsan and one of his parents provide the income for his family. Since 2012, he has owned a small shop where he sells handbags. Ahsan has a good reputation in the surrounding area and has one employee.

Ahsan is requesting a 2,400 USD youth loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and increase his profits. His goal is to open a bigger shop one day with more accessories to sell.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: El joven Luis de 24 años de edad es casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de el. El cliente trabaja desde  hace 1 año  para la alcaldía como policía municipal. Tanto su esposa como sus hijos dependen de el ya que solo el trabaja. Solicita este nuevo crédito para la construcción de una cocina y baño que le  permitirá tener mas espacio en su casa ya que actualmente es la sala que le sirve de cocina. Con el crédito anterior logro construir un porche.
texts.en:
The young, 24-year old Luis is married.  His wife is a homemaker, and he has 3 dependent children.  

The client has been working for a year for the town hall as a municipal policeman.  His wife as well as his children depend on him, as he is the only one who works.

He is applying for this new loan to build a kitchen and bathroom that will allow him to have more space in his house, because they are currently using the living room as a kitchen.  With the previous loan, he was able to build a porch.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, cement, iron and sand.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose de 51 años de edad vive junto  a su familia su esposa y sus hijos. Es un hombre visionario que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un padre y esposo ejemplar  que sus deseos de superación siempre han sido altos, siendo responsable, honesto, humilde, trabajador y muy emprendedor. Se dedica al cultivo de la granos basicos siendo mas especificos maiz y frijol, Y tambien vende muebles elaborados de Bambu pero su profesion es ser agricultor. Desde hace varios años se ha dedicado a esta actividad y lo hace con esfuerzo y dedicación. Jose  desea comprar insumos para seguir comercializando sus productos y que no se le arruinen por no tener lo necesario para cultivarlos es por eso que ha tomado la iniciativa de acercarse a INTEGRAL  para solicitar un crédito y comprar insumos como: Abonos, Fertilizantes, Pesticidas u otros. Espera que la ayuda que solicita se le sea dada ya que cuenta con buenas referencias de pagos y espera saldar la deuda antes de lo previsto.
texts.en:
José, 51, lives with his family, his wife and his children.  He’s a forward thinking man who has always been noted for being an exemplary father and husband.  His drive for self-improvement has always been strong; he’s responsible, honest, humble, hardworking and very enterprising.

He works growing basic grains, specifically corn and beans.  He also sells furniture made from bamboo but his profession is being a farmer.  He’s worked in this occupation for several years and he does so with much effort and dedication.

José wants to buy supplies to continue selling his products and to keep them from becoming damaged for lack of what’s needed to grow them.  This is why he’s taken the initiative of approaching INTEGRAL to request a loan to buy supplies like manure, fertilizer, pesticide and others.  He hopes he’ll be granted the support requested because he has good payment references and he expects to repay the loan ahead of time.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: El joven Jose Cruz de 29 años de edad es soltero, no tiene hijos, las personas que dependen de el son su mama y hermana. El trabaja para la Alcaldia como operario de limpieza desde hace 1 año. Solicita este  credito para la compra de materiales como zinc para poder hacer un cambio de techo en su casa de habitacion ya que el que tiene actualmente esta en muy malas condicones y se pasa el agua cuando llueve y afecta la calidad de vida de el y su familia ya que su mama es una señora de edad.
texts.en: Jose Cruz is 29 years old. He is single and doesn't have any children. The people he supports are his mother and his sister.  He has been working for City Hall as a janitor for one year. He is requesting this loan to purchase materials like zinc in order to replace the roof in the house where he lives, because the one they have now is in very bad condition and water leaks through when it rains. This impacts his and his family's quality of life, since his mother is an older lady.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc, purlin beams, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Fifonsi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale, de cartes de recharge et des chaussures dans une boutique, Fifonsi est une jeune dame de 31ans. Elle a pour conjoint un chauffeur et non pas encore d’enfant en charge. Afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et des cartes de recharge, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES. Le profit qu’elle va réaliser lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et assurer la pérennité de son activité.
texts.en: Fifonsi is a 31 year old woman who sells general food products, shoes and rechargeable mobile phone cards from a small boutique. She is married to a chauffeur, and do not yet have any children. In order to stock up on more food and cards to sell in her store, she is asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use all profits to improve the living conditions of her family and ensure the long term sustainability of her business.

loans.use: purchase general food products and rechargeable mobile phone cards

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
Ghassan is a 57-year-old married man who is the father of two children. He has been working in the food business since he was 14 years old and his extensive experience has provided him with customer trust and support. Ghassan is a hard worker who makes sure that his store has everything his customers might ask for. He knows everyone's needs, and puts forth so much so much effort to please them.
 
Ghassan is applying for his sixth loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase store merchandise to provide special offers and support his business. His previous loans were invested for the same purpose and have helped him to improve his living standards and develop his business. Ghassan's loan is especially important to manage special spring and summer needs and requests.

loans.use: to purchase store merchandise to provide special offers

loans.name: Sabiha

texts.en:
Sabiha is 61 years old and a widow with three children. She lives in Iraq and is the only provider for her family. Sabiha opened a grocery store in 2002 and she sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergent, and snacks. She built good experience in her field and is well-known in surrounding areas and has an excellent reputation.

Sabiha is requesting an 1,800 USD loan to buy a generator and to increase her food supply inventory. In the future she hopes to expand her business and increase her profits so that she may be better able to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy a generator, food, and supplies

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El sr. Francisco de 54 años de edad es casado, su esposa es ama de casa, las personas que dependen de el son su esposa y sus padres quienes ya son unos ancianos y es su esposa quien se encarga del cuido de ellos. Solicita este credito para la compra de materiales como zinc y ampliar su casa que es toda construida de laminas de zinc, tambien comprara materiales como piedras canteras ya que su sueño es tener construida su casa de concreto para en un hogar seguro y digno con su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is 54 years old and married. His wife is a homemaker, and he supports her and his parents, who are seniors. His wife takes care of them. He is requesting this loan to purchase materials like zinc in order to build an addition to his house, which is made entirely out of sheets of zinc. He will also buy other materials, like quarry stone, because his dream is to have his house built with concrete so that he and his family can live in a safe and decent home.

loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc and quarry stone.

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is a 26-year-old youth client from Iraq. He is married and has one child. Hussain is the only provider for his family. Since 2009, he has owned a small grocery store where he sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergent, and snacks. Hussain has good experience and is well-known in surrounding areas with an excellent reputation.

Hussain is requesting an 1,800 USD youth loan to install a new rolling shutter for his grocery store. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter for his grocery store

loans.name: Johel Antonio

texts.es: Johel de 38 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia. Johel se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas, siendo esta  su principal fuente de ingresos, Ha realizado esta actividad por mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida honradamente. Él es un hombre muy responsable, honesto y dedicado en su trabajo. Es muy conocido por sus vecinos los cuales dan buenas referencias de su trabajo como de su persona. Cada año repite está actividad ya que es una persona muy humilde y de escasos recursos el cual no puede tener   otro tipo de negocio o trabajo. Este año al igual que los anteriores ha decidido cultivar la tierra y ya que la temporada de siembra está cerca él quiere estar preparado con los  insumos agrícolas necesarios  para cosechar los principales granos básicos. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a esta institución, INTEGRAL, ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios  para realizar la inversión. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas,  etc. De esta forma espera lograr cultivar los principales granos básicos de este año para poder llevar el pan de cada día a su familia.
texts.en:
Johel, 38, lives with his family in a house that they own. Johel grows vegetables as his main source of income. He has been doing this for a long time, which is how he earns an honest living. 

He is a very responsible man, honest and dedicated to his work. He is well known among his neighbors who give good references to his work as much his character. He repeats this activity every year as he is a very humble and poor person with scarce resources so he can do no other type of business or work. 

This year, as with years before, he has decided to farm, and since planting season is close he wants to be prepared with the necessary agricultural supplies to harvest basic grains. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL because he does not have the financial resources to make the investment. The loan will be invested in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as seed, fertilizer, insecticide, etc. In this way, he hopes to cultivate the basic grains this year so he can bring home the daily bread for his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seed, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock of food supplies.

loans.name: Nouha

texts.en:
Nouha is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been working in selling clothes since five years ago. 

Nouha is a hard worker. She puts so much effort into improving her business as much as she can to make sure that her customers are pleased and satisfied. 

She is applying for her second loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise with special spring and summer collections.

In addition to clothes selling, Nouha is starting to sell accessories to diversify her products.

Nouha’s previous loan supported her family a lot, through providing them with the necessary things they need.

She hopes that she can expand her business more and more in the future to make sure that her customers will be satisfied and her family will live a normal living where they can get anything they need.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with special spring and summer collections.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets of zinc, wood, nails, and beams.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 35 years old and is married with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in the suburb of Tbilisi city with his wife and family. Nugzar works as an artisan on construction projects for private contracts and his family also has a small plot of land that they cultivate. This business is looked after by Nugzar's wife who sells the harvest locally for a small monthly income. Nugzar has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start up a family business, but his loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nugzar is requesting a loan from Credo to start up a greenhouse business and purchase iron pillars and polyethylene coverings to build a greenhouse and cultivate vegetables to sell in Tbilisi markets. His loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo that envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. His new business, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will give Nugzar's family the chance to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: purchase iron pillars and polyethylene coverings to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa e hijo. Él se dedica  al cultivo de los principales granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado desde hace muchos años,  las cuales realiza año con año para llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Estas actividades son las que le permiten  cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y Do las ragoberto realiza con gran empeño y dedicación. Él es un hombre trabajador,  honrado y responsable vive en condiciones muy humildes junto a su familia y esta es la razón que le motiva a trabajar duramente para dar lo mejor a su familia ya que es la única forma  de poder cambiar la realidad en la que se encuentran. Dagoberto sabe que con un poco de ayuda para invertir en sus cultivos y en la crianza de su ganado podrá generar más ingresos los cuales le ayudaran a cambiar el futuro de su familia, es por estas razones que se acercó a INTEGRAL, para solicitar un crédito el cual solicita para invertir en la compra de ganado y de insumos para sus cosechas como pesticidas, abono, semillas, etc. ya que son sus dos únicas fuentes de ingresos y espera que estas cosechas sean mejores que los años anteriores para tener buenos ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Dagoberto lives in his own house with his wife and child.  He has earned a living for many years growing the main basic grains and raising livestock, which he does year in and year out to put food on the table in his household.

These jobs are what allow him to cover the basic household needs, and Dagoberto carries them out with great effort and dedication.  He's a hardworking, honorable, and responsible man.  He lives in humble conditions with his family, who motivate him to work hard to give them the best.  This is the only way of being able to change the reality in which they live.

Dagoberto knows that with a little help to invest in his crops and in raising his livestock he'll be able to generate more income, which will help him change his family's future.  This is why he went to Integral to request a loan to invest in buying livestock and supplies for his crops, such as pesticide, fertilizer, seed, etc.

These are his only two sources of income and he hopes these harvests will be better than in previous years so he has good income for his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is a thirty-year-old lady, married to Elisavan and the mother of four lovely children. She operates a grocery store in Kawangware. She has been in this business for four years and earns a monthly income of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES 60,000). This will be Naomi's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy groceries, such as potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes, to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, such as potatoes, cabbages and tomatoes, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Alejandro Eugenio

texts.es: Alejandro de 41 años de edad, vive junto a su familia su esposa y sus hijos, en casa propia. Es muy conocido por sus vecinos por ser muy responsable, honesto y sincero en su hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un buen padre y esposo ejemplar y gracias a Dios jamás le ha quedado mal a nadie. Alejandro se ha dedicado toda su vida hacer agricultor y comercializa todo lo que cosecha gracias Dios posee buenos clientes que siempre se han destacado porque le ayudan en la compra de sus productos. Pero en estas últimas cosechas no ha tenido buenas ganancias es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: semillas, herbicidas, fertilizantes entre otros. Gracias a Dios confía en que su vida mejorara y seguirá llevando el sustento diario a su casa
texts.en:
Alejandro is a 41-year old man who lives with his wife and children in their family house. He's very well regarded among his neighbors as a very responsible, honest and sincere person, as he's always been a good father and a model husband and, thank goodness, he's never let anyone down.

For his whole life, Alejandro has worked in agriculture and sold everything he cultivates. Thank goodness he has good clients that have always stood out for buying his products. However, he hasn't had good earnings in the last few harvests, which is why he's requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy farming supplies, such as seeds, weed-killer and fertilizer, among others. He's confident his life will improve and that he'll be able to provide daily for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as seeds, weed-killer and fertilizer, among others.

loans.name: Shota

texts.en:
Shota is 33 years old and is married. He lives with his wife in the small village of Telavi District. Shota works as an agricultural worker in the village and he has a wood-cutting machine that he uses to harvest wood. He brings timber from the forest using his own horse and sells it in the community. Shota's business barely provides enough food for the family. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start up a family business, but his loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Shota is requesting a from Credo to start up a business and purchase calves to raise and sell. His loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo that envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor who do not have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. His new business, financed with his Kiva start-up loan, will give Shota's family the chance to significantly improve their living conditions.

loans.use: purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married, and has two children. Hussein and his wife provide the income of the family. Hussein is a car mechanic. After working for over ten years in this field, he established his own business in 2009, and now he has one employee. He has built up good experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation. Hussein is applying for a loan of $2,400 to pay the yearly rent on his shop and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent on his auto repair shop and to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 33 years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her children and husband in Samburu, Kenya. She owns a charcoal store--a business she had been engaged in for the past two years. Her major monthly expenditure is to pay school fees. She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, from Naivasha, is 40 years old, and she is married to Mwangi. They have three children, who are in school. Mary has operated a timber business for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to purchase a larger stock of timber for sale. She hopes to expand her business and improve her standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of timber to sell in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quarry stone, cement, iron, etc.

loans.name: Yonis Eduardo

texts.es: Yonis de 22 años de edad, habita junto a su familia conformada por ser 6 personas, pero el nada mas trabaja para darle una mejor condicion de vida a su esposa. Es un hombre trabajador, honesto y decidido a seguirle brindando un buen futuro a su familia.  Con sus buenos modales y forma de tratar a la gente es responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar y todo lo hace con alegria y entusiamos. Actualmente Yonis se dedica  al cultivo de granos básicos es así como honradamente se gana la vida, y hace que su familia posea grandes admiraciones porque se caracterizan por ser trabajadores y visionarios. El cliente desea comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos ya que se vienen épocas de cosechas y desea tener lo necesario es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de Semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Espera tener la ayuda solicitada para tener las mejores cosechas y venderlos como siempre lo ha hecho y que en su hogar no falte el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Yonis, 22, lives with his family comprising six people but he works just to provide his wife with a better quality of life.  He’s a hardworking, honest man determined to continue providing a good future for his family.  He’s well-mannered and treats people well and he’s responsible with his home obligations; he does everything joyfully and enthusiastically.

Currently, Yonis works growing basic grains; this is the way he earns his livelihood honorably and sees to his family being highly regarded because they are noted for being hardworking and visionary.

He wants to buy farm supplies for his crops because harvest time is nearing and he wants to have everything necessary.  This is why he’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and pesticide among others.  He hopes to get the requested support in order to get the best harvests to sell them like he’s always done so that his home will not lack daily bread.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, etc.

loans.name: Khadir

texts.en: Khadir is from Iraq. He is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Khadir and two of his children provide the family income. Khadir is a mechanic. He established his business in 2000, and now he has one employee. He built up good experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation. Khadir is applying for a loan of $2,400 to install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter at his shop, as well as to buy some specialized equipment for his work. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his children with a good future.

loans.use: to install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter for his shop, as well as to buy some specialized equipment for his work

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.en:
Maria Paz is 37 years old and married with three children.

Maria Paz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items  like shampoo, oil, sugar and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Maria Paz has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Maria Paz aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, oil, sugar and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
Eduarda is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. Her husband is a driver. She has been thinking how to run a big business.

Eduarda is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as Coca-cola, Fanta, Sprite, noodles, bread, cigarettes, and eggs. 

Eduarda opened her kiosk one year ago with her own capital of $200.

loans.use: to buy Coca-cola, Fanta, Sprite, noodles, and bread.

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en:
Hamed is 46 years old and married with six children. He lives in Iraq and three of his children are employed. Hamed is a mechanic and he owns a small garage. He established his business in 1995 and now has one employee. Hamed has built good experience in his field and is well-known in the surrounding areas as having an excellent reputation.

Hamed is requesting a 2,100 USD loan to install signage and a rolling shutter as well as to buy a generator for his garage. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and increase his profits to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to install signage and buy a rolling shutter and a generator for his garage

loans.name: María Gumercinda

texts.es: Maria habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar su esposo y sus hijos. Ella se dedica  a la agricultura de granos básicos como maíz, frijol. Esta actividad la realiza  junto a su esposo y es así como logran llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.  Maria es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora  y responsable.  Siempre se ha  dedicado a la agricultura por lo que  conoce muy bien la manera de hacer esta activada. Cada año realiza esta actividad de la cual vende una parte de su cosecha y la otra la deja para consumo. Es así como poco a poco va saliendo adelante y dando a su familia el alimento básico. Vive en condiciones muy humildes junto con su familia, esto la hace agarrar más fuerzas para seguir luchando por un futuro diferente. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos agrícolas como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Es así como  se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Espera que  este año la cosecha sea favorable y logre cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
María lives in a house that’s her property with her family group: her husband and children.  She works in agriculture growing basic grains like corn and beans.  She does this work with her husband and this is how they manage to provide daily bread for their home.  

María is an enterprising, hardworking and very responsible woman.  She’s always worked in agriculture so knows very well how to do this work.  She does this work every year and sells part of her harvest and uses the remaining part for home consumption.  This is how she’s gradually been getting ahead and providing basic nutrition for her family.

She lives with her family under very humble conditions which leads her to find the strength to continue striving towards a different future.  She’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan to buy farm supplies like seeds, manure, insecticide, etc.  This is how she earns her living and provides daily bread for her home.  She hopes this year’s harvest will be favorable and to reach her dream.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like seeds, manure, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина замужем. У нее есть взрослый сын. Валентина продает кондитерские изделия на рынке на протяжении 15 лет. Она добрый и отзывчивый человек в жизни и внимательная с клиентами на работе.

Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 17000 гривен. Она хочет сделать ремонт в ванной и заменить  окна в доме. На данный момент ванной комнаты нет в доме. Валентина хочет улучшить жилищные условия благодаря кредиту.
texts.en:
Valentina is married and has an adult son. She has been selling candy at the market for the last 15 years. She is a kind and outgoing person, and is attentive to her customers at work. 

Valentina is seeking a loan of 17,000 Ukrainian Hryvnya so she can renovate her bathroom and replace the windows in her home. She currently does not have a bathroom in her house. She wants to improve her housing conditions with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to renovate her bathroom and replace her windows in her home

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 45 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. In 2010, her husband purchased a truck for transportation purpose.

For three years, Batbayar has been selling coal at retail prices by purchasing coal at wholesale prices from the outdoor market. She is requesting a loan for 1,200,000 MNT, which she will use to rent a grocery stall at the trade center. This new business will contribute to her family's income generation. Because the trade center is in a residential area, a lot of people will pass the grocery stall each day.

loans.use: to rent a grocery stall.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia works hard to support three children. She has a business buying and selling vegetables and fruits in the Philippines.

Eulalia requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Eulalia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter's transport business is still doing well. He is taking his fourth loan with KADET LTD after paying his previous loan successfully. He is grateful to KADET and Kiva lenders for the financial help he has been receiving, which has enabled him to expand his business.

Peter is requesting an education loan to pay for his children's school fees. His hopes and dreams are to give his children a quality education and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.name: Abdumomin

texts.ru: Абдумомин житель района А.Джоми. Ему 49 лет. У него большая семья - жена и семеро детей. Старший сын находится на заработках за пределами страны. Сам Абдумомин вот уже 13 лет как занимается животноводством. Он покупает коров и телят, откармливает их и затем продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. Абдумомин берет кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. За счет прибыли он хочет устроить свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Abdumomin lives in the A. Jomi region. He is 49 years old and has a large family - he and his wife have 7 children. His eldest son is a migrant worker in a foreign country. 

For over 13 years, Abdumomin has been working in animal husbandry. He buys cows and calves, fattens them, and then sells them for a profit at the cattle market. He is now seeking a loan for the purchase and sale of cattle. He wants to use the income generated by this loan to host his son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Sabzagul

texts.ru:
Сабзагул жительница района Хамадони. Ей 41 год. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Ее сын занимается торговлей CD и DVD дисков. Сабзагул имеет среднее образование. 
Сабзагул более шести лет работает на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает детскую одежду. Сабзагул берет кредит для покупки сезонной одежды.
texts.en:
Sabzagul lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 41 years old, divorced, and has 2 children. She has a high school education. Her son sells CDs and DVDs. 

For more than 6 years, Sabzagul has been working at the market. She rents a sales outlet where she sells children's clothing. She is seeking a loan to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing to expand her range of goods

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a charcoal vendor. She is in her forties, and she and her husband have four children, all enrolled in school. She has been running her business for three years and reports that both her family and her business are doing well. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to earn a fair profit each month.

Beatrice is requesting her first loan from Kiva's field partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use her loan funds to buy more sacks of charcoal to offer for sale. This will allow her to meet the current demand as well as to increase her income. Her dream is eventually to be able to expand her business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mshikamano," which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a single man of twenty-eight years. He supports his father by providing basic needs for him. Simon does a taxi business in Kangemi and has been doing so for the last five years now. He gets a monthly income of thirty-two thousand KES.

This will be Simon's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire amount to buy new tyres for his taxi and also take the taxi for service. In the future he wants to own a tour company.

loans.use: To buy new tyres and take the taxi for service

loans.name: Nabae

texts.en:
Nabae, age 28, is a tailor. She is unmarried and lives with her parents, and she is the sole provider for the family.

Nabae specializes in tailoring both children's and women's clothes. She established her business in 2006 and has built up good experience in this field. She has become well-known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation.
 
Nabae is requesting a youth loan in the amount of $1,800, which she will use to buy a new tailoring machine. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she make her dream come true, which is to open a tailoring institution.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany de 30 años de edad tiene su propio gimnasio, donde vende servicios de salud divertidos y efectivos. Su idea de emprendimiento surgió cuando practicando gimnasia, en un negocio de su primo en el año 2007, observó que era un negocio rentable y empezó a soñar con su montaje, logrando su sueño cuando su familiar se fue a otra ciudad y le vendiera el negocio. Su mercado está concentrado en el barrio donde habita y en los sectores ubicados alrededor de este, en ellos hace permanente  volanteo y ofrece a sus clientes reales  buen servicio, que  incentiva la venta de su menú gimnástico. Su meta más adelante es expandirlo agregando una sala de aeróbicos , con la que gradualmente incrementará su oferta ; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su primer credikiva en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues hará adecuaciones locativas, que facilitan extender su local, aumentar el potencial de clientes y la comodidad de estos, que con su crecimiento se ha convertido en un gran desafío.
texts.en: Dany is 30 years old. He owns his own gym where he offers fun and effective health services. His enterprising idea came when he was working out at a gym in his cousin's gym in 2007. He saw that it was a profitable business and he started to dream of opening one. His dream came true when his relative went to another city and sold him the business. His market is the people who live in the neighborhood where he lives and in nearby areas. He always puts out flyers there and offers his customers a good service that incentivizes sales of his gymnastic menu. His goal for the future is to expand it, adding an aerobics room, which will gradually increase what he has to offer.  This is the reason that he is turning to his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will make improvements to his locale that will make expanding it easier, increasing the potential for customers and their comfort. This has been a big challenge with all the growth.

loans.use: to do some improvements on his gym.

loans.name: Yunusbek

texts.ru: Юнусбек житель района Шахритус. Он женат. Ему 34 года. Образование у него среднее. Юнусбек занимается растениеводством. Также он зарабатывает строительными работами. На сегодняшний день Юнусбек хочет заняться торговлей. Он берет кредит для аренды торговой точки, покупки миндаля и грецких орехов, чтобы начать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Yunusbek lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 34 years old and married. He has a high school education. He grows crops for a living and supplements his income by working in construction. He now wants to get into sales. 

Yunusbek is seeking a loan that will allow him to rent a sales outlet and to buy almonds and walnuts so he can start his own business.

loans.use: to rent a sales outlet and to buy almonds and walnuts to start up his own business

loans.name: Ne'matullo

texts.ru: Неъматулло житель района Хамадони. Ему 23 года. Он холост. Неъматулло занимается торговлей более одного года. Рядом с домом у него имеется собственный магазин, где он продает продукы питания и домашние принадлежности. Неъматулло очень предприимчивый молодой человек. Он хочет увеличить товарооборот. С этой целью он запрашивает кредит для приобретения ассортимента товара (продукты питания и домашние принадлежности).
texts.en: Ne'matullo lives in the Hamadoni region. He is a 23-year-old bachelor. Ne'matullo has been engaged in a retail business for more than one year. Next to his house he has a store, where he sells food and household goods. Ne'matullo is a very entrepreneurial young man. He wants to increase his store's turnover, and with this purpose in mind he is requesting a loan to purchase new assortment of food and household items for his store.

loans.use: to purchase new assortment of food and household items for his store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is still doing her business of farming, which is doing well. This is her third loan after repaying her second loan successfully. She is grateful to KADET LTD and Kiva lenders for the financial help she has received so far.

She is requesting a business loan to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer for the planting season. With the anticipated profit she will expand the farm and be able to meet her children's education expenses. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: Ariel tiene 49 años de edad y vive al sur de la ciudad con su familia conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 13 años. Desde  hace 2 años, Ariel inició el negocio de vender víveres al crédito, pues estuvo empleado 24años en una empresa de fotografía donde perdió su trabajo y decidió ser independiente vendiendo productos de primera necesidad entre sus vecinos y amigos, Con ellos su clientela fue referida paulatinamente y ha crecido; él compra directamente a los mayoristas y obtiene buenos descuentos, y vende a crédito,  por lo cual no siempre tiene el capital de trabajo para responder a su creciente y potencial clientela; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, productos de aseo, porque planea aumentar una vez más sus ventas, ofreciendo precios competitivos, porque trasladará los descuentos de sus proveedores al desarrollo de su clientela. Su meta es duplicar sus ventas para terminar de adecuar su vivienda y finalmente ofrecer a su familia cada vez un mayor bienestar.
texts.en: Ariel is 49 years old. He lives in the south side of town with his family, which is made up of his family, his wife and two children, aged 3 and 13. Two years ago, Ariel started a business selling groceries on credit. He had worked for 24 years in a photography business where he lost his job. He decided to become independent by selling basic necessity products to his neighbors and friends. With them he was recommended and his customers slowly grew in number. He buys directly from wholesalers and gets good discounts, selling on credit. Because of this, he doesn't always have the working capital he needs to respond to his growing and potential clientele. That is why he has turned to a Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy groceries and cleaning products, because he plans on increasing his sales again by offering competitive prices, because he will pass the discounts from his suppliers on to his customers. His goal is to duplicate his sales so he can finish his home and finally offer his family a better well being.

loans.use: to buy groceries and cleaning products.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, age 41, runs a grocery store business to earn an income. He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2010, and now has one employee. He has built up good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area. He has an excellent reputation.

Ibrahim and his wife have three children. He lives with 10 family members, four of whom are employed.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of $3,000, which he will use to buy two new freezers and a new refrigerator, as well as to install a display window. 

He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new freezers and a new refrigerator, as well as to install a display window

loans.name: Malvis Maria

texts.es: Desde el año 2001, Malvis, de 36 años se dedica a elaborar mechas de trapeadores en franela, de una forma muy artesanal; negocio con el que ella y su esposo han logrado aumentar el bienestar de su familia la cual existen 4 hijos en las edades de 13 a 17 años. Su emprendimiento surgió cuando trabajando su esposo,  como empleado en una empresa de producción de mechas de trapero, los propietarios de esta, le propusieron que comprara el material y se dedicara a elaborar los productos, garantizando sus antiguos patronos su venta, pues  ellos comprarían lo producido, y así lo hizo en compañía de Malvis, quien dirige todos sus esfuerzos a sacar adelante su pequeña fábrica artesanal.   La materia prima es adquirida mediante la compra por pacas en la ciudad de Bogotá, para ser transformada en el domicilio donde habitan y trabajan todos los días de lunes a viernes y desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Su meta es producir en mayor volumen, pero su infraestructura es insuficiente para mejorar los tiempos productivos, así como también tiene un gran desafío con su  capital de trabajo, con el cual  no logra hacer  compras significativas para ganar descuentos por amplios volúmenes de materias primas. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina y material de algodón, para incluir esta nueva línea de mechas de trapeadores y así aumentar sus utilidades, porque tiene como propósito familiar lograr  apoyar los estudios profesionales de cada uno de sus hijos, para que disfruten de un futuro muy prometedor.
texts.en:
Since 2001, Malvis, who is 36, has been making flannel strands for mops, using very manual methods. This business has allowed her and her husband to increase their family's wellbeing. They have four children who are ages thirteen to seventeen. 

Their business venture started when her husband was working for a company that made mop strands and the owners proposed that he purchase the material and make the product himself. His ex-employers guaranteed their product's sales, because they would buy as much as they made, so that is what he did along with Malvis, who dedicates all of her effort to keep her small manufacturing business going. 

The raw material they need is bought in bales in the city of Bogotá, and is transformed in their home, where they live and work daily, Monday through Friday from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. Her goal is to increase production, but she doesn't have the infrastructure to improve their production time. Working capital is another big challenge, because it doesn't allow her make significant enough purchases to obtain discounts for buying large amounts of raw material. 

She is currently requesting a Kiva loan which will be her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase a machine and cotton material, in order to include a new line of mop strands to increase her profits. Her goal for her family is to be able to support each of her children's professional education, so that they can have a very promising future.

loans.use: to buy a machine and cotton material for a new line of mop strands.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is 21 years old and comes from Dalarik village. She lives with her parents and sister and together with them, Alina runs a farm. Their farm currently includes two cows, 50 chickens and also peach, apricot, plum and appletrees. The whole family works hard to gather a good harvest and sell it in the local markets. For Alina and her family, agriculture is the only source of income. But unfortunately that income is hardly enough for covering family's basic costs.

As they don't have sufficient financial means to pay for fertilizer, which is very important for growing trees, Alina has applied for this loan. With the loan's help, Alina will be able to purchase fertilizer and her family will be able to continue the expansion of their farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is 45 years old and married. She has three sons ages 17, 16 and 13. They are all schoolchildren. Her husband works at the Gas department in  Baku city, the capital of Azerbaijan.  

About three years ago the river Kur burst its banks and damaged the houses at their village. Elmira's house is a clay building and as a result of the flood it has significant damages. She dreams of building a new safe house from stone, and when the eldest son gets married they can all live together.   

For more than 17 years she has been working in animal husbandry, having started this business with only one cow. Thanks to her hard work, her farm now includes 1 bull, 3 cows, 30 head of sheep and 11 lamb. In addition, she sells cucumbers that she plants at the greenhouse. For the purpose of further developing her business, Elmira has approached VFAC for a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy 2 dairy cows so she can increase her earnings from the sale of milk. Her three cows now are not able to give milk, they will give birth to calves.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Yuris Mercedes

texts.es: Útiles escolares colonias, productos de tocador y ropa interior y exterior femenina, fue lo que Yuris compró con su anterior credikiva, con el cual aumentó su prosperidad. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, pues su capital de trabajo sigue siendo insuficiente para responder al incremento de su clientela, que pide artículos para el hogar, perfumería, cosméticos y ropa; por eso con su credikiva, complementará su compra y dará satisfacción a su clientela, que cada vez es más fiel y le permite a ella ganar un poco más. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva:  “ Con la ayuda recibida mi negocio y mi familia han prosperado estoy extremadamente agradecida
texts.en:
Colony school supplies, ladies' toiletries and undergarments and womens' clothing are the products Yuris bought wither her last Kiva credit, which has increased her prosperity.  Now she is applying for a new loan, because her work capital continues to be insufficient to respond to an increase in customers that ask for home products, perfume, beauty products and clothing.  

With her new Kiva credit, she will supplement her purchase and satisfy her clients, who are more and more loyal and allow her to earn a little more.  She says to the Kiva financial backers: "With your help my business and my family have prospered, and I am extremely grateful."

loans.use: to buy home products, perfumes, beauty products and clothing

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Ibrahim owns a small shop and specializes in copying and printing documents and selling stationery. He established his business in 2006. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ibrahim is requesting a $1,200 loan to buy a color printer and to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a color printer and increase his inventory

loans.name: Fenny

texts.en:
Fenny is a 49-year-old poultry farmer and nursery school teacher in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and her husband provides additional income. Together, they support two people. Fenny has been in the poultry business for the last seven years and she is doing great.

This marks her sixth loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). The previous loans were successfully paid. 

Fenny will purchase timber and iron sheets to expand her poultry house. She hopes to own a large poultry farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber and iron sheets to expand her poultry house.

loans.name: Abed Ali

texts.en:
Abed is from Iraq. He is 56 years old, married and has three children. Abed is the only provider for the family.

Abed owns a small shop for selling fresh chicken. He established his business in 2000, and now he has an employee. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Abed is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase timber, new hammers, nails, and chisels for use in his workshop. His business is progressing well and he has been able to pay back his first loan successfully. David hopes to continue accessing credit at KADET LTD.

loans.use: to purchase new hammers, nails, and chisels.

loans.name: Hangnidé's Group

texts.fr:
Mme HANGNIDE est la représentante du groupe. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 08ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 01 va  à l’école et elle a 01 personne en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et prêt à porté pour enfant  depuis 05ans.  Elle s’approvisionne  au marché de  secteur 10. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes de son secteur et des  secteurs  environnants.
Mme veut s’acheter  12complets pagnes et 35 prêts à porter. 
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle  a toujours pour ambition  d’installer un hangar, acheter un motocycle et  aider son mari avec  les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Hangnide is the group’s representative. She is doing fine. She is married and has two children, eight and five years old. One child is in school, and she has one other dependent. Mrs. Hangnide  has been selling traditional “pagnes” fabrics and ready-to-wear children’s clothing for five years. She stocks up at the Sector 10 market. Her customers are men and women living in her sector and nearby. She would like to buy 12 “pagnes” sets and 35 ready-made outfits. She would like to save her earnings. Her goal has been to build a shed,  buy a motorbike and help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy 12 sets of “pagnes” fabric and 35 ready-made outfits.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
Kazem is 42 years old, married and has two children.  He is from Iraq and is the only provider for the family. Kazem is a cowman. He specializes in raising cows and selling dairy products, which he has been doing since 2000. He built a good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Kazem is requesting a loan for $2,400 loan, which he will use to buy a cow. He wants to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is 35 years old, married, and has three children.  She is from Iraq. Both Rana and her husband provide for the family together.

Rana is tailor and works from home, which she has been doing since 1996. She specializes in weaving all types of women outfits. Rana has gained an excellent reputation and is well known in the surrounding area.

Rana is requesting a loan for $2,400, which she will use to buy a new sewing machine and a motor generator. She wants to expand her business and increase her profits so that she may improve her family’s current financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and a motor generator.

loans.name: Cliff

texts.en:
Cliff is 27 years old. He owns a pharmacy and also offers money transfer services (MPESA), which he has been doing for the one year. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

Cliff is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more medicine for his pharmacy.  He will use the proceeds from his business to open another pharmacy.  Cliff hopes to own a wholesale drugstore and be the biggest drugs supplier in Thika.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Berardo

texts.es: Bernardo, un hombre de 61 años, procedente de Santa Cruz de Mompox, hermoso municipio, ubicado a orillas del Rio Magdalena, nació en una familia tradicionalmente ganadera y desde sus 17 años se trasladó con ella a la ciudad e Barranquilla. Como para no perder la conexión con su pueblo natal, emprendió su propio negocio, interpretando intuitivamente las necesidades de un segmento de mercado y la forma de acceder a productos alimenticos de excelencia producidos en Santa Cruz de Mompox y finalmente con su experiencia de vida logró trasladar hasta Barranquilla, artículos de consumos diario, para venderlos en un mercado que los demandaba, atendiendo la oferta de Bernardo. Así fue como inició su primera experiencia, con vecinos y amigos vendiéndoles suero, queso, bollos de maíz. Poco a poco la calidad de los productos que vendía dio sus propios resultados y hoy ha consolidado una clientela y un buen nombre en el mercado. Así mismo ha logrado un capital de trabajo, que invierte en su negocio y con sus utilidades apoya el sostenimiento de su hogar, hasta llegar a incursionar en el mercado de la compra y venta de ganado vacuno en pie y esto lo hace en el municipio que lo vio nacer. Últimamente ante las posibilidades de adquirir todos los productos que ofrece, para responder a la creciente demanda y ante la necesidad fortalecer su negocio de ganado, encuentra que su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para lograrlo, por eso acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará queso, bollo, suero, galletas y un toro. Su credikiva es el tercer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con este apoyo logró aumentar su liquidez, las ventas y sus utilidades, así mismo terminó de construir el segundo piso de su vivienda y esto lo hace sentir satisfecho y con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando para aumentar sus posibilidades de bienestar y lograr sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Bernardo, 61, from Santa Cruz de Mompox, which is a beautiful town situated on the banks of the Rio Magdalena, was born into a family that traditionally raises cattle. At the age of 17, he moved with his family to the city of Barranquilla. 

So as not to lose the connection with his hometown, he started his own business, intuitively interpreting the needs of the market segment, how to access the excellent food products produced in Santa Cruz de Mompox, and finally with his own life experience, he managed to transport goods for daily consumption to Baranquilla and sell them in a market. That was how he gained his first experience - selling whey, cheese and corn rolls to freinds and neighbors. 

Gradually the quality of the products he was selling got its own results and today he has an established clientele and a good reputation in the market. He has also acquired working capital, which he invests in his business and with the profits, he maintains his home, and has even managed to enter the market of buying and selling cattle which he does in his hometown. 

Lately, faced with the acquiring all the products that he sells to meet growing demand, and faced with the necessity to strengthen his cattle business, he has found that his working capital is insufficient to achieve this, so he is requesting a loan to buy cheese, rolls, whey, cookies and a bull. This is the third loan that he will receive from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this assistance, he is able to increase his liquidity, sales and profits. In this same way, he was able to finish building the second floor of his home which makes him feel satisfied and eager to continue working to increase his chances of well-being and achieve his dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy cheese, rolls, buttermilk, cookies.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is 25 years old and single.  He has been working in the transportation business for three years. 

Mohamad is requesting a youth loan from Al Majmoua, which he will use to start a car trading business as additional income. His present business is based on towing cars from one place to another for repairs, but he needs an additional income to improve his standard of living.  Mohamad hopes to own a car selling agency in the future. He is a hard worker who puts much effort in improving his business.

loans.use: to start car trading business.

loans.name: Heizel

texts.en:
Heizel is the eldest among five siblings. She is 27 years of age and single. 

At the age of 23 years old, she tried her luck at business. Heizel runs her rice retailing business. Though it’s quite hard to manage a business, she does her best in order to help her parents in generating funds. Heizel’s gained income goes towards her daily necessities, payment for her rice stall and motorcycle, and allowances for her four siblings. 

Heizel is able to dispose of 500 sacks of rice in a month. She wants to re-stock her rice stall. That’s the reason why she’s asking for additional capital of PHP 50,000. This amount of loan will be used to buy sacks of rice. She hopes for approval of her requested loan amount, so she can provide customer satisfaction and earn better income for her family's necessities.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for her retail business.

loans.name: Llane

texts.en:
Llane is 57 years old and married with 11 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She sells nipa huts (bamboo and palm frond bungalows) in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over seven years, and earns 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 27 years. He is married and a father of three children. Imad is the only provider of the family.

Imad is a mechanic and owns a small garage. He established his business in 2009 and now he has an employee. He has built good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a sum of $3,000 as a youth loan to pay the yearly rent of his shop as well as to increase his inventory. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent of his shop as well as to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victoria, a mother of three, has been a widow for three years, having lost her husband in an accident. Despite the tragedy, she has never lost her hopes, instead working hard in order to earn a living. Her first business was an eatery, but since it burned down, she has been struggling financially.

Victoria is now selling fruits such as apples, mangoes, lanzones, grapes, and some “cornik”,”butong pakwan” and green peas. As a single parent, she needs more income to sustain her children's needs, educate them, and give them a comfortable lifestyle. To help realize her goals, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy stocks of fruits, ”cornik”, captain seed ( butong pakwan) and green peas. Victoria hopes and prays that she will get this loan amount.

loans.use: to buy  stocks of fruits such as mangoes, lanzones and apples, as well as  ”cornik”, captain seed ( butong pakwan) and green peas for her retail store.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 47 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and operates a business of selling flowers in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for more than three years and earns 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month.

She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilzer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzer such as manure.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 62 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Calamba, Misamamis Occidental. To earn a living, Joel operates a motorcycle transport services in the local community, which he has been doing for over two years.  Joel earns 15,000 PHP every month. 

Joel is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which he joined in 2011, for 20,000 PHP, which he will use to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Zinakan

texts.ru: Зинакан 56 лет, вдова. Муж Зинакан скоропостижно скончался в 1998 году, и она осталась одна с тремя детьми. За это время Зинакан выдала замуж двоих дочерей. Зинакан в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, после развала СССР занимается торговлей детской одежды, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зинаканы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется торговое место на рынке с хорошей проходимостью,в обороте имеется 200,000 KGS,бизнес ежемесячно приносит около 15,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зинакана обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на увеличения ассортимента детских вещей. Доходы от кредита Зинакана будет вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zinakan is 56 years old and a widow. Zinakan's husband died unexpectedly in 1998, and she was left alone with three children. Since then, Zinakan has married two daughters away. 

In search of a main source of income for her family, Zinakan has been selling children's clothing since the collapse of the Soviet Union, after having started this business with an amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zinakan's persistent work, she currently has her own selling point at the market. It is at a good location, with a lot of people passing by, and she has 200,000 som (KGS) in turnover. The business brings in around 15,000 som (KGS) per month. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zinakan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to increase the assortment of children's goods. Zinakan will invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: To  increase the assortment of children goods for resale

loans.name: Alaywi

texts.en:
Alaywi is an Iraqi client who is 52 years old and has two wives and two children. Alaywi and one of his children provide the family income.

Alaywi owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2000 and now he has hired an employee. He has built up good experience in this field and is becoming well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Alaywi is requesting a sum of $2,400 as a loan to install signage, a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to install signage, a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell clothing

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 31 years old, married, and has two children.  She is from  Samburu, Kenya and has a cafe, which she has been operating for the three years.

Mercy is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy food ingredients and a sack of potatoes. She and her family live in their own house with solar power and tapped water.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients and a sack of potatoes.

loans.name: Nury Octavia

texts.es: Nury es una mujer de 62 años de edad casada y que tiene 2 hijos adultos. Ella tiene un taller de cerámicas y artesanías en tela, actividad que aprendió cuando en el año 1993 ayudaba a su amiga, quien tenía un negocio  y allí obtuvo gran experiencia en la producción de artículos de cerámicas y en tela especialmente de muñecas de trapo, lo que la llevó a emprender su propia aventura artesanal. Su ritmo de trabajo es de 10 horas diarias de lunes a domingos, posee una clientela fija a la que le vende a crédito y también de contado, mientras sus compras las realiza de contado en almacenes de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su meta es lograr incrementos en la producción, incursionando en el mercado potencial, ubicándose en un local de un importante almacén de cerámicas.
