Danielle has received 2 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to continue to grow her business through the loans. She would like to buy a parcel of land for her family in the future. She hopes her children will be educated and successful.

loans.use: to buy mattresses for sale

loans.name: Marly

texts.es: Marly está muy feliz porque hizo adecuaciones en sus dos apartamentos y esto fue gracias a su credikiva, la cocina y las paredes lucieron relucientes y mucho más higiénicas.  Hoy planea invertir en su negocio, comprando refractarios, un horno para preparar pizzas, para aumentar su producción y dice  que Dios siempre estará con ella. Ella envía “un saludo de gratitud a los señores de Kiva  con su labor están ayudando a mucha gente que ellos no conocen,   pero que estamos  muy agradecidos. “
texts.en:
Marly is very happy because thanks to her previous Kiva loan she was able to make improvements to her two apartments.  The kitchen and the walls now shine brightly, and conditions are much more hygienic.  Currently she is planning to invest in her business, buying baking stones and and oven for making pizzas, so that she can increase her production.

She believes that God will always be with her.  She sends "a message of gratitude to the Kiva lenders, who through their work are helping many people whom they haven't even met, but we are very grateful."

loans.use: to buy baking stones and and oven for making pizzas.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is still doing farming on her piece of land. She has been able to expand her business thanks to the financial help she has received from KADET LTD and Kiva. Her monthly income has increased and now she earns 8,000 KES. She is requesting a second business loan to enable her to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. 

She will use the anticipated profits to prepare her land for the next planting season. Her hopes and dreams are to excel in her business as farmer.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food products to raise funds for a wedding.

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es: Emilse de 35 años de edad tiene una tienda en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, ubicado a orillas del mar, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 6 a 15 años. En Enero del año 2011, su suegro, de edad avanzada y toda la vida dedicado a una tienda, decidió entregársela a su hijo y  a Emilse para generar su sustento. En su tienda vende al detalle artículos de la canasta familiar como víveres, ranchos, refrescos, cárnicos, lácteos etc. Su negocio es atendido por Emilse desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche todos los días, vendiendo a crédito y en un mayor porcentaje de contado, lo que compra a mayoristas de mejor oferta en el mismo municipio donde habita. Su principal clientela son amas de casa y en general vecinos, que compran al detalle los artículos y productos, que requieren en su canasta familiar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual planea aumentar el surtido de su tienda, comprando productos con descuentos,de primera necesidad, arroz, aceite, carnes, salsas, azucar, leche etc  que la ayudan a tener un inventario con artículos y a manejar precios competitivos.
texts.en:
Emilse, 35, has a shop in the town of Puerto Colombia, located by the seashore, where she lives with her partner and their four children (ages 6 to 15). In January of 2011, her elderly father-in-law, who had devoted his life to the store, decided to give it to his son and Emilse to generate their livelihood.

In the shop she sells retail items like groceries, snacks, soda, meat, dairy, etc. The business is run by Emilse from 6 am to 9 pm every day, selling items on credit and more commonly in cash, which she buys wholesale at the best deals in the town where she lives. Her main customers are housewives and in general, neighbors, who buy retail items and products that they need for household consumption. 

She is currently requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she plans to increase the stock in her store, buying discounted products (staple items) like rice, oil, meat, sauces, sugar, milk, etc. that help her have an assorted inventory and to manage competitive prices.

loans.use: to buy discounted products (staple items): rice, oil, meat, sauces, sugar, milk.

loans.name: La Restauration 2 Group

texts.en:
Regis, age 33, is single with a 7-year-old daughter. She is currently attending school. He is representing the La Restauration 2 group. Regis sells movies, DVDs and music and has had this business for eleven years. He will use the loan to buy a computer to use in transferring songs and movies. His business strategy is to sell many things that people need in his shop, including phone cards and a cell phone charging station. 
Regis has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He wants to grow his business and begin selling DVDs in bulk as a supplier to other vendors. He hopes his daughter will be happily married one day.

loans.use: to pay for a computer to use in transferring songs and movies.

loans.name: Elizabeth Maria

texts.es: Elizabeth y su esposo se las ingenian para sostener a su familia, pues jusntos están  comercializando   aliños en pequeñas cantidades,  que empacan manualmente y venden en tiendas y en pequeños establecimientos comerciales. Su idea emprendedora nació al observar la necesidad del mercado y conocer la experiencia de su competencia con esta actividad. Elizabeth además de su  tarea  como reempacadora,  realizada  en compañía de su esposo,  es modista y genera otros ingresos que ayudan mucho en el bienestar de su hogar. La meta de esta pareja es que su hijo de 16 años, llegue a ser una profesional de éxito y por eso su afán de hacer crecer sus ingresos, con el fin de apoyar su bienestar, tanto como ellos puedan. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, mediante el cual comprará, en mayor volumen  aliños, que manufacturarán en mínimas cantidades, usadas a diario por las familias. El éxito de su credikiva es su experiencia, capacidad de trabajo, disciplina y objetivo común por el que su familia   trabaja  en equipo para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth and her husband manage to support their family by working together selling decorative items in small quantities.  They pack these items manually and sell these in stores and other small commercial establishments.  Their business idea was born when they observed a need in the market and knew that they had experience and competence in this area.

In addition to her work packing these goods, which she does alongside her husband, Elizabeth is a dressmaker and makes additional income that helps very much to improve the well-being of their household.  The couple's goal is to help their 16-year-old son to become a successful professional, which is the source of their eagerness to grow their income and support his well-being in the best way that they are able.

Elizabeth is currently applying for a loan which she will use to buy decorative items at wholesale prices.  They will resell these in small quantities to be used daily by families.  What will make them successful is their experience, their capacity for hard work, their discipline and their common goal that the family is working toward as a team.

loans.use: to buy decorative items at wholesale.

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en:
Buenaventurada is a 58-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in the rice farming business together with her family.

Buenaventurada is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income.

In the future, Buenaventurada dreams of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Dondalina

texts.en:
Dondalina is a farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been in the rice farming business for several years. Dondalina hopes to expand her business but lacks the financial resources for expansion.

Dondalina is applying for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these things, she will be able to improve and enhance the productivity of her farm.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for her rice farm

loans.name: Elida

texts.en: Elida is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children living in Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living through food vending. She sells home-cooked snack foods to the people in her local area. Elida is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter and milk. Through this loan, Elida hopes to augment her sales and profit. She dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate the income necessary for the needs of the family especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, butter and milk.

loans.name: Oybi

texts.ru: Ойби разведенная женщина с четырьмя детьми. Ей 55 лет. Она проживает в городе Вахдат. Ойби женщина со стойким характером. Несмотря на трудности она не отчаялась в жизни и одна воспитала детей. Вот уже несколько лет как Ойби занимается торговой деятельностью. Она на рынке города арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Чтобы увеличить товарооборот, Ойби обратилась за кредитом для приобретения ассортимента товара (фруктов). В будущем Ойби надеется расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Oybi 55 years old, divorced and has four children.  She lives in the city of Vahdat. She is a persistent woman.  Despite coming up against hardships, she has never despaired and raised her children alone.  She has worked selling goods for several years.  She rents space at a city market where she sells her wares.  In order to increase her turnover, Oybi is taking out a loan to buy an assortment of fruits.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase an assortment of fruits with the goal of increasing turnover.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is single and has no children. She has received an education, through secondary school. Elizabeth sells women's products, including sandals, bags, and cosmetics, in Elmina. She has done this work for some time, now. Elizabeth uses her income to support herself and pay all of her own expenses.

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of products to offer to her female customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to develop her inventory further and to save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of products to offer to her female customers.

loans.name: Dosti

texts.ru: Дости 54 года. Он с женой и тремя детьми проживает в городе Вахдат. Дости работает в сфере торговли в течение 5 лет. Он на рынке города арендует торговую точку, где занимается продажей продуктов питания (конфеты, печенье, булочки, сладости и т.д.). Дости целеустремленный человек. Он просит кредит для приобретения продуктов питания с целью увеличения товарооборота. За счет прибыли с продажи Дости планирует приобрести новую торговую точку.
texts.en: Dosti is 54 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the city of Vahdat.  For five years, he has sold goods as a profession.  He rents space at a city market where he sells his food products (candies, cookies, rolls, sweets and so forth).  He is a goal-orient person and is taking out a loan to buy more products to sell.  His goal is to increase his turnover and with his additional profits, he plans to find a new place from which to work.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell, the income from which will be used to rent a selling location.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a lady of twenty eight years, married to Cyrin and a mother of two children. She operates a grocery store in Kangemi and has been in this business for ten years now. She makes a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Judith's first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy fruits and vegetables for sale. In future she wants to own a shop.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is a sociable and kind woman. She is married and has two adult children, Jasur and Salohiddin. Her husband is an actor at the theatre. The income of her sons and husband is low and that’s why she decided to start her own animal husbandry business. She will buy cattle, care for them for 40 days and then re-sell at a higher price. She studied the course ‘To get ahead’ at a women's organization and received a certificate. She has a good knowledge about business. She is smart and perfect and that’s why she will be a good business lady. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy cattle to start her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a 46 year-old hardworking entrepreneur. She is married with four children whom are all in school. As a result, her major monthly expenditure is school fees. She lives in Samburu Kenya with her family in her own build house which is electric powered house with tapped water. She owns and operates a retail shop in a nearby town.

She has approached for a loan amounting to ksh.90,000 to restock her shop and buy basic goods and commodities,sacks of sugar,wheat and maize flour and cooking oil. She hopes this will enable her satisfy her customers who keep growing thanks to a good customer relationship.

loans.use: to restock her shop and buy basic goods and commodities such as sugar,wheat, maize flour and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Leofanis Mercedes

texts.es: Leofanis con su credikiva anterior surtió sus tiendas y en consecuencia sus ventas se incrmentaron, pues lo hizo teniendo en cuenta los artículos de mayor rotación, así mismo agregó un pequeño punto de variedades en el que le ha ido muy bien y esto es muy bueno para el bienestar de su familia. Su credikiva tendrá éxito, porque registra diariamente todo lo que su clientela necesita y compra y en eso enfoca  su inversión, que en la actualidad será en artículos de la canasta familiar, papelería, cosméticos y perfumería.
texts.en: With her prior loan, Leofanis bought merchandise for her store, and as a result her sales increased.  She took into account which items were in the highest demand, and also added to the variety of items she offered, which went very well and helped to improve her family's well-being.  Her loan was successful, because on a daily basis she recorded what her customers needed and wanted, and she in turn focused her investment on these items.  Currently these items are household goods, stationary, cosmetics and perfume.

loans.use: to buy groceries, stationary, cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Manuchar

texts.en:
Manuchar is 35 years old. He lives in Kobuleti District, with his wife, mother, brother, and sister-in-law. Manuchar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land where they grow citrus and nut trees. Harvested products are sold locally, at the market, and the family gets a small monthly income that is not enough to feed a five-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Recently, Manuchar requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Credo approved his loan request, in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit, with soft conditions, to Georgia's rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Manuchar will purchase a minibus and work on the line. He will transport people between his village and Batumi, and will earn a monthly income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up Loan, will increase the family's income and enable them to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a minibus so he can begin a business, transporting people between his village and Batumi

loans.name: Jose Alfie

texts.en:
Jose Alfie is a 33 year old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has one 11 year old child. He is in the fishing business. He has been in this business for 10 years now. This is the source of his income and for the rest of their family needs. 

Jose Alfie is requesting for a loan to buy fish nets, hooks and floaters. This will be use in fishing. By the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs in his fishing business.

In the future, Jose Alfie hopes to expand his business. He also wants to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, hooks and floaters for his fishing business

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is 34 years old. She lives in Samburu, Kenya with her family. She is married with two children whom are all in school.They live in a rental house but she hopes to build her own house in the future.She owns and operates a retail shop near Samburu town.

She has approached for a loan amounting to ksh.40000 to buy cooking oil, bundles of cooking oil and sacks of wheat flour. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bundles of cooking oil and sacks of wheat flour.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer is 42 years old. He lives with his daughter and parents-in-law in Gardabani District. Vladimer has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Vladimer works as a distributor in a private company and gets a monthly income. It consists of 400 GEL per month and it is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vladimer has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. His loan request was approved under the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Vladimer will purchase chickens to start a poultry farm. He will place the chickens in a shed located in their yard. He will raise them and sell them for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian sells vegetables in Elmina. Vivian has received no formal education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a sanitary worker at Cape Coast University. Vivian has been selling vegetables for some time now. She is responsible for helping her husband pay their children's school fees and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy an increased quantity and variety of vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her vegetable stand.

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity and variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman and a mother of seven children from San Miguel, Bohol. She is engaged in making and selling ice buko. Ice buko is local snack food and is made from milk, shredded coconut, fruit and other flavorings. It is a favorite refreshing food of the locals especially of the young children because of its sweet and delectable taste.
Elizabeth wants to expand her business however she lacks the financial resources to do so. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients used in making ice buko such as milk, sugar, vanilla extract and shredded coconut. With this, she will be able to make and sell more ice buko.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making ice buko such as milk, sugar, vanilla extract and shredded coconut.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 46 year-old business lady. She is married to Peter. She has been practicing mixed crop farming for the past four years with a monthly income of KES. 10,000, which she uses to support her family. Lucy is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after she was introduced to KADET by an existing client.

She intends to use the loan to purchase maize and bean seedlings and fertilizer. With the anticipated profit from the business she will empower her children with education. Her hopes and dreams are to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to purchase maize and bean seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Ms. Shagufta is a 47-year-old, married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She accepted the fact that, if her husband were working alone for their family, they would not be able to meet the expenses of their household or the educational needs of their children. So, together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now, she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000, to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons, zippers, and lace, in various colors. In this way, she will be able to satisfy the increasing demand of her customers, consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Shagufta has been in association with Kashf Foundation for nine years. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and packs of buttons, zippers, and lace, in various colors.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bassines, de sauts et plats en plastiques à domicile,  Akossiwa vit avec sa famille(conjoint et 05 enfants à Lomé). Trois de ces derniers sont scolarisés. En 2002, akossiwa a commencé son activité et s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Afin de subvenir aux besoins des clients, elle fait son premier prêt à WAGES pour acheter des  marchandises. A l’avenir, elle veut ouvrir une boutique et assurer au mieux les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Akossiwa lives in Lomé with her husband and her five children, three of whom attend school.  

She resells tubs, buckets and plastic containers from home, an activity she started in 2002.  She buys her products at the Grand Market in Lomé.  

In order to meet her customers' needs, she is taking her first loan with WAGES.  She will use this loan to buy some merchandise.  

In the future, she would like to open a shop and do her best to ensure that her family's needs are covered.

loans.use: to buy tubs and plastic containers.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms Nasreen is a 31-year-old married woman. She is been in the beauty parlor business for two years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing services she has become very famous in her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a bigger variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. She contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for a loan because she has low cash in hand. She needs a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy large quantities of hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening. In this way she will be able to cater for more customers which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Shiasta

texts.en: Ms Shiasta is a 26-year-old lady who has been running a sewing business for the past six years. She is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Shiasta was not earning, her family was going through a financial crisis that compelled her to use her sewing skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family; due to limited resources she could not afford the expenses of her children’s education. So she felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. She is a brave woman but she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s when her husband advised her to borrow from Kashf. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and packs of ribbons, laces and zippers in different colors. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and packs of ribbons, laces and zippers in different colors.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is into gari production.  Gari is made out of cassava.   Araba sells her gari recipe at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for five years now. She is married to a farmer and has five children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. 

Araba will use her loan to purchase cassava to produce gari to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava to produce gari to sell.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Ms. Saima is a 28-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past six years. Her husband also assists her in making beautiful patterns. She is zealous about her work, and customer demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed at a hosiery factory, but he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Saima’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of three children, all of them school-going.

Saima wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR. She will use it to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls, in large enough quantities to satisfy the increasing demand of her customers.

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her town. She would like to teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and at the same time, earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market, to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as thread, sequins and pearls, in large enough quantities to satisfy the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is into gari production. Gari is made out of cassava. Ama also sells doughnuts at Asebu near Cape Coast, which she has done for 12 years now. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their accommodation and utility bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase more cassava to produce gari to sell and also to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnut sales. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava to produce gari to sell and also to buy flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnut sales.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is 40 years old and enjoys doing hand embroidery work. She started doing this work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. Due to increasing demand of her embroidery designs, she is including other women in her business. 

Musarat has seven children, and her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to support the needs of the family. Musarat is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demand for her embroidery, she needs to buy more material. For this, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. With this loan she can buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors, which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors

loans.name: Lucia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando.  Ella trabaja como encargada de limpieza en un hospital, desde hace diez años. Antes ella junto con su esposo se dedicaba a la agricultura; pero gracias a una amiga se le presento la oportunidad de trabajar en el hospital. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. a preparar el desayuno a sus hijos, luego los envía a la escuela y ella queda en casa realizando los oficios. A las 2:00 p.m. se prepara para irse a su trabajo en el hospital, ya que su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 p.m. a 6:00 a.m. del siguiente día. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para realizarle un chequeo medico a su madre; ya que se encuentra enferma y tiene que realizarle unos exámenes médicos y no poseen el dinero para realizárselos por su propia cuenta. Es necesario contar con el dinero, pues Lucia nos comenta que su madre es muy importante para ella. 

Otro de sus propósitos, es graduar a sus hijos en la universidad; para que se les presenten mejores oportunidades de trabajo. Además, desea construir su propia casa ya que actualmente vive en casa de su mamá.
texts.en:
Lucia is 39 years old, is married and has two children in school.  She has worked as a cleaning supervisor in a hospital for the past 10 years. Prior to this she had worked as a farmer with her husband, but thanks to a friend she got the opportunity to work in a hospital.  She gets up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her children.  Afterwards she sends them to school and completes household chores.  At 2:00 p.m. she prepares to go to her job at the hospital, where she works the overnight shift.

She is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo to pay for medical exams for her mother, who is ill and does not have the money to cover her own medical expenses.  Lucia reports that her mother is very important to her.

Another goal of hers is for her children to graduate from college, so that they will have better career opportunities. Also, she wants to build her own home since she currently is living in her mother's house.

loans.use: to pay for medical exams for her mother, who is ill and does not have the money to cover her own medical expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase footwear, bags, hair extensions, and men's and women’s underwear to re-sell.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Ms. Tahira is 30 years old, a married woman, and a mother of four children. All of her children are school-going. She has an expertise in hand-embroidery, and she has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 10 years. She started this line of work in the very early days of her marriage. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community and to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread, stones and beads.

Recently, she requested a loan worth 40,000 PKR, to purchase more spools of thread with packs of sequins, beads, and glittering material. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of sequins, beads, and glittering material, for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a single parent and has 7 children. Ekua is a fish monger and sells her fish in Asebu Brebia, which is near Cape Coast. Ekua also sells a variety of other foods as well including yams, limes, and cooked rice.  Ekua has been selling food for about 15 years now.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children, as well as pay for their school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell. She will also use part of her loan to purchase yams, bags of rice, and vegetables to prepare her food to sell. With the profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro de 53 años de edad habita junto a su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia. Es un hombre con diversas capacidades y cualidades que los vecinos, siempre con la disposición de ayudar a quien lo necesita Pedro es muy amable, con los que lo buscan, responsable con sus actividades ya que es muy conocido porque es muy amable y sericial. Actualmente se dedica a la labor de ser agricultor,cultiva granos basicos ,gracias a su manera de ser posee de clientes quienes lo buscan por precios accesibles ademas se dedica a vender naranjas. En esta ocasión necesita que INTEGRAL le brinde un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas, ya que los que tenia se le terminaron y para esta próxima cosecha necesita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Espera contar con la ayuda puesto que no tiene otros recursos para seguir alimentando a su familia
texts.en: Pedro is 53 years old and lives with his wife and their children in their own house. He has many skills and qualities and is always happy to help out his neighbors. He is well-known for being responsible, kind, and helpful. He is currently working as a farmer, growing basic grains. Thanks to his personality, he has customers who come to him for his affordable prices. He also sells oranges. He is in need of a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can buy farming supplies because the ones he had have run out, and he needs to buy more of the following supplies for the next harvest: seeds, manure, fertilizer, pesticides, among other items. He hope he can count on this support because he does not have any other way to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa sells groceries at Asebu Brebia. She is married and has 8 children. Her husband is a carpenter.  Adwowa has been in this business for the past 8 years now. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of their family with her income. Adwowa will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers' demand and she hopes to expand her grocery business with increased profits from her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Msangale Group

texts.en:
Christopher’s group has 10 farmers and is located in Kakamega south district. Christopher is pictured on the right of Msangale Group with his hand raised. Christopher is pictured amongst the six men and four women of his group. He will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Christopher first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Christopher joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and use increased profits to send his children to school.

Christopher reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about nine bags of maize per one acre, but with his One Acre Fund input loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 10 bags per one acre! He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and save for the future. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Christopher’s group will receive five acres worth of inputs on credit.

The field officer is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 25 years old. She lives in Mtskheta District with her husband, parents-in-law and two children who are going to school.  Manana requested a loan for the family business from local financial institutions several times but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The family has two milk cows. Manana and her mother-in-law are milking the cows every day to make cheese which is sold locally at the markets. They also have a car which Manana’s husband and father-in-law are using as a taxi to drive local people. According to Credo's estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Manana requested a loan from Credo to strengthen the family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the credit received, Manana will purchase a car and it will be used as a taxi. Her husband and father-in-law both work in separate cars as drivers to increase the family income. The profit will be used to buy more cows and produce more milk to make cheese. The new business initiative, financed with this Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To buy a car for her husband to work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba produces the traditional dish kenkey for sale. Kenkey is mashed, fermented corn dough that is a local treat in Ghana.  Aba is the woman sitting behind the kenkey and her four assistants who help her in the kenkey production are covering the corn dough with banana leaves as a form of packaging. She is married to a farmer and has 4 children. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the family. Aba needs this loan to purchase bags of maize in bulk for her kenkey production. With the new profit Aba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize in bulk for her kenkey production.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 32-year-old hardworking lady. She is married to Noah and they live harmoniously in Samburu, Kenya with their three children, two boys and a girl. She owns a retail shop, a business she has been doing for the last three years. She has applied for a loan in the amount of KES 25,000 to restock her business with sacks of maize flour and bundles of wheat flour. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to restock her business with sacks of maize flour and bundles of wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a fish monger and also sells the traditional corn dough, kenkey.  Ama has been in the fish business for about 5 years now. She is married with 4  children. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children.  Ama will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale and bags of maize to produce her kenkey recipe to sell. Ama will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale and bags of maize to produce her kenkey recipe to sell.

loans.name: Sunaani

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunaani, is an experienced trade woman who lives in Makassar on the island of Sulawesi, Indonesia.  Makassar is one of the largest cities in Indonesia and has all the problems third world cities have: including a lack of access to safe and affordable drinking.  That is why Sunaani started to sell Nazava Water Filters.  So far she has been very successful: Three times she ordered water filtersand each time all her filters were sold out within a day. 
Because Sulawesi is an island, the filters need to be shipped with an unreliable and slow boat service which needs almost two weeks to get the Nazava Water Filters to mrs Sunaani. That is why she is in urgent need of more stock. Besides, the shipping costs would be reduce by almost 50 % when she orders a few more boxes. “Many many people here want a filter, but I do not have money to increase my stock”, as Sunaani told to Nazava’s sales manager. 
With a Kiva loan, Mrs Sunaani can make safe and affordable drinking water available to 1000 people in just 1 month. The loan allows her to buy around 200 water filters for a bigger discount and with lower transportation costs. By supporting Mrs. Sunaani, it’s not only her business that will be boosted but more families will have access to safe and affordable drinking water and these families will also save money and increase their disposable income.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of water filters and increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in her region.

loans.name: Abamwe Group

texts.en: Juliet is a married woman aged 46. She has six children whom she has been able to educate with the support of income she gets from her business. She joined the group through the group chairperson who had successfully ran his business since 1999 with the help of the UGAFODE loans. She was encouraged and also enrolled for the same and has since been grateful. She is a very hard working woman who earns UGX 250,000 or more daily. She sells and buys onions and through this business, she saved and accumulated income to buy a plot of land in the village. She will use the Ugafode loan for business development (buying more onions) and to educate her children. Her main challenge is the bad debtors but otherwise she appreciates the services she has gained from Ugafode Micro Finance Limited and believes the new partnership with Kiva will create a lasting impact.

loans.use: To buy more stock of onions

loans.name: Maryum

texts.en:
Maryum is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. By this time, she has become famous for selling good-quality cloths in her community. 

Maryum requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloths for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a high-quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloths for summer season

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is 34 years old, married with two children. She lives in Samburu, Kenya in a house they built which has electric power and tap water. She has a establishment where she prepares food and resells it. She has been doing this for the last five years.
She has applied for a loan amounting to KES. 50,000 to pay fees for her children. She is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to pay fees for her children.

loans.name: Safiatu

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Safiatu. She is married and has 3 children aged 22, 12 and 12. In 2003, Safiatu established her drinks, rice, oil, pure drinking water etc. business. She began her business because she wanted to help with her children's education and for the smooth running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are the general community. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Safiatu requires a loan in order to buy bags of rice, cooking oil, drinks, pure drinking water etc. for sale.  In the future, Safiatu plans to build more houses and stores for expansion of the business and to educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more bags of rice, cooking oil, drinks etc

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells footwear, African-print cloth, and men and women’s underwear in Asebu Brebia near Cape Coast. She is divorced and has 5 children. Ekua has been selling these items for the past 5 years. As a single parent, she is responsible for feeding, clothing, and paying her children’s school fees. 

She will use her loan to purchases footwear, African-print cloth, and men and women’s underwear for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop to sell her goods.

loans.use: to purchases footwear, African-print cloth, and men and women’s underwear for resale.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Ramata.  She is married and has 4 children aged 20, 16, 8 and 6 years. In 2007, Ramata established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to help in the smooth running of the home. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are men and women. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Ramata requires a loan in order to buy more bamako materials, Senegal suits, cosmetics materials for resale. In the future, Ramata plans to become an international business woman, and give a quality education to her children up to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for more clothing materials

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac lives together with his wife in Egyirfa near Cape Coast. He produces charcoal to sell and he has done this work for 20 years now. He uses his  income to provide food and shelter for his family. He will use his loan to purchase firewood to produce the charcoal to sell. With the new profit from his expanded business, Isaac will produce charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to produce charcoal  to  sell.

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is 36 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in Kvareli District. Khvicha requested a loan for the family business start-up from local financial institutions several times but without any success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Khvicha is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard. Besides the agricultural work, he trades in fruits and vegetables with his own minibus. He is able to earn 500 Laris (GEL) per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Khvicha requested a loan from Credo to start his family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the credit received, Khvicha will purchase calves, raise them, and then resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with this Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves, raise them, and then resell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells tasty doughnuts in her community near Cape Coast. Esi has been preparing her doughnut recipe for the past 5 years now. Esi is married and has 2 children.  She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Esi will use her loan to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnut production. With the profits she will expand her business and save for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and cooking oil for her doughnut production.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua lives with her husband who is a farmer. The couple has 2 children. They all live in the village of Egyrafa near Cape Coast. Efua sells raw rice and canned tomatoes and has done this work for the past 3 years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Efua will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and boxes of canned tomatoes to sell. With the new profit from her loan, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and boxes of canned tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ingrid Leticia

texts.es:
Ingrid tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera, vive junto a su prima. Su mamá vive en Estados Unidos, manifestando que su mamá tuvo que emigrar con el objetivo de obtener una mejor estabilidad económica y  una vivienda.

Ella, se dedica a trabajar en la organización de eventos sociales y religiosos. En la  decoración  y ambientación de las áreas donde estos se desarrollan. Generalmente, estos los realiza en un hotel  conocido, situado en la playas El Cuco. Con este hotel trabaja desde el año 2009, y le ha permitido obtener los ingresos suficientes para mantenerse en el negocio y terminar con sus estudios universitarios en el que se logró graduar de licenciada en computación. 


Todos los insumos y materias primas que utiliza los obtiene en la ciudad, el que se encuentra a unos 45 kilómetros de la ciudad donde reside, el personal que contrata de forma temporal, es el de la zona de las playas, pues hay instituciones estatales y ONG´s que han capacitado a personas en lo que se refiere a la atención al cliente.

El préstamo será invertido en: $200.00 en materias primas para la elaboración  decoración y $800.00 en la compra de mesas y sillas para el negocio. Con la inversión, ampliará sus equipos y serán de mejor calidad. A veces las mesas y sillas que renta están bien deterioradas y no permiten dar la imagen, presentación  y comunidad requerida.

Con el trabajo que está haciendo está ganando reconocimiento, por lo que espera crecer en equipos y prestar sus servicios en otros hoteles de mayor prestigio.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 26 years old, single, and she lives with her cousin.  Her mother immigrated to the United States with the goal of finding more economic stability and a home.  Ingrid works as a coordinator for social and religious events, and she decorates the locations where the events take place.  Generally, they take place in a well-known hotel situated on the beaches of El Cuco.  She has worked with the hotel since 2009, and her job has provided her the income necessary to maintain her business and to finish her degree in information technology.  

All of the supplies and materials that she uses are found in the a city that is 45 kilometers from the city in which she lives.  The temporary workers that she hires are from the beach area, and they have been trained by state institutions and NGOs in customer service.  

Ingrid will invest this loan in her business: $200 for decoration materials and $800 to buy tables and chairs.  With this investment, her teams and services will be of better quality.  Sometimes the tables and chairs that she rents are very worn down, and they don't provide the image, presentation and feel required for such events.  Because of the good job that she does, Ingrid is becoming well-known, and she hopes to grow her business and to provide her services in other high-class hotels.

loans.use: to buy decorating materials and $800 for the purchase of tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Philemon. He is married and has no children. In 2010, Philemon established his pharmacy business. He began his business because he wanted to empower his wife to be self-employed. His business is located in the market center of town and his main customers are children, and men and women, young and old. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Philemon requires a new loan in order to buy more drugs to meet the needs of the people in the market area. He hopes that this loan will help his business to achieve his goal and objective through proper utilization. In the future, Philemon plans to establish a first-class pharmacy in the eastern part of Freetown. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more drugs

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi cooks banku and serves it with okra soup and fish at Eygirfa near Cape Coast. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a driver in their community. She supports her partner to educate, feed and clothe their children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, fish and other ingredients to cook her banku recipe for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a stall in which to sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, fish and other ingredients to cook her banku recipe for sale.

loans.name: Kirisiet

texts.en:
Kirisiet is 30 years old. He is married and a father of four children aged between five and fifteen. He has been in farming for the last six years. He learned about KADET from women who are already registered members of KADET LTD. This will be his second loan after paying back the previous loan successfully. 

He plans to spend the loan amount to prepare the land and buy chemicals and fertilizer for his wheat farm. Because of the climate condition and fertile soil, wheat has proved to do very well and also the market is readily available in the area for both retail and wholesale buyers. 

Kirisiet hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming and own farm machinery.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Abdulai. He is married and has no children. In 1998, Abdulai established his fishing business. He began his business because he wanted to assist his family. His business is located on the outskirts of town and his main customers are fish sellers and the general community. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,800,000 leones (SLL) every month from his business. 

Abdulai would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Abdulai requires a loan in order to buy more fishing net and thread. He hopes that this loan will help his business to expand with the proper use of the loan. In the future, Abdulai plans to build more boats, buy more machines and educate the children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for fishing nets and thread

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is now 44 years old, married and living with her children. Apart from her retail shop, Jane is also a tea farmer. She has been in in this business for three years and earns an income of KES16,000. She is now servicing her fourth loan of KES20,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use the loan to purchase more fresh green tea leaves from local farmers for resale. The anticipated income from the business will be used to pay off her loan and pay her children's school fees. Her dream is to prosper in life.

loans.use: to purchase fresh green tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta, now 57, used her last loan to buy more goods to sell in her business. She bought sugar, cooking oil, and salt, among other items, and it has been profitable.

This will be her third loan, and she plans to use the money to buy more sugar, maize flour, and rice. She anticipates making more income, which she will use to pay her grandchildren's school fees.

She hopes to expand her business to wholesale and make more income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy stock, such as sugar, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Marly compró harina en bultos y otras materias primas con las que elaboró panes y productos de repostería, con el aumento de su producción vendió mas y obtuvo más dinero para comprar en mayor volumen con lo que ganó muchos descuentos, que se trasladaron a sus utilidades. Desde que recibió su credikiva, ofrece productos a un mejor precio y su clientela cada día crece más; esta es la razón por la cual acude a una nueva financiación  con Kiva, mediante la cual comprará harina de trigo, grasas, azúcar etc. para aumentar una vez más su producción y generar muchos más ingresos que beneficien a su familia.
texts.en:
Merly bought packaged flour and other ingredients with which she made breads and pastries. With the increase in her production, she sold more, and obtained more money to buy in greater volume, so that she earned many discounts that have gone into her profits. 

Since she received her credikiva loan she has been offering products at a better price and her clientele grows each day. This is the reason why she is approaching the institution for new Kiva financing through which she will buy wheat flour, cooking oils, sugar, etc. This is to increase her production once again and generate much more income to benefit her family.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oils, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: This is 38 year-old Adama. She is married and has two children, ages 22 and 11 years old. In 1998, Adama established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-employed and assist her husband. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are fish sellers. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Adama requires a loan in order to buy more cartons of fish for resale. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase her profits. In the future, Adama plans to build a house and take good care of her children's education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more cartons of fish.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, a 37-year-old father of four children, has a metal workshop in Kangundo town. He has been in the business for three years and it has been profitable. He makes metal door frames as well as windows.

This is his second loan term, and he plans to use the amount to buy more metal material for use. This will enable him to make more metal doors and window frames to sell. He will use the generated income to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to grow his business by opening another metal shop in the area and to make more income so as to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more metal material to make door frames and windows.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a 52-year-old food stall proprietor in Gogoni, Kilifi. She is married and her husband makes additional income. Together they support three people.

This marks her fourth borrowing from KADET LTD to purchase sacks of potatoes for making fries and cooking fat. Her previous loans were paid successfully. 

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children who are now in secondary school. She hopes to own a successful business with a prosperous family in future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes and cooking fat for her food stall.

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is 63 years old, and a widow. She lives in the Lagodekhi district with her son, daughter in-law, and two grandchildren who are going to school. Tsiala has asked for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests are rejected because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

Tsiala rented a small space one month ago to sell clothes and bedding, but she doesn’t have enough stock. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary of Tsiala’s son, who works as an economist at a private company. Their monthly income is not enough to feed five members of the family. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tsiala has asked for a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are seen as “high risk borrowers.” With the received credit, Tsiala will trade in clothes and bedding. She plans to buy at wholesale prices and then resell at a higher price in her newly opened shop. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will give Tsiala a chance to improve the wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bedding at wholesale prices.

loans.name: La Restauration 1 Group

texts.en: Cesar, age 46, is single with three children, ages 6 to 11 years old. All of his children are currently attending school. He is representing La Restauration 1 Group. Cesar has a business transporting manioc from the villages just outside of Brazzaville to the markets in Brazzaville. Manioc is a popular food made from the cassava plant and is a staple in most Congolese homes. He has had this business for six years. He will use his loan to continue his current transportation business as well as install a small stand to sell foufou, another staple food like manioc. His business strategy is to quickly get the manioc to the market and in the hands of vendors. He knows the customers want to buy the freshest food possible. Cesar has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to have other activities in the future, especially producing his own manioc.

loans.use: to pay for the transportation of manioc to the market.

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is a 40-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Bwooma - Rukungiri District. He is a butcher and a hardworking customer of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) - Rukungiri Branch, where he has been for the last six years.

With this loan, he will buy more pigs and goats that he will slaughter and sell to his customers in order to increase sales that yield high returns. With that, he is able to educate his children and look after his home by providing the necessary household requirements. 

Tobias is now able to sufficiently cater for a number of clients in his business and meet their demands since his capital base has increased with the help of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited's services.

loans.use: To buy goats and pigs for slaughter.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
A 60-year-old farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol, Bonifacio has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than 20 years. This is the source of his income; rice farming is a lucrative venture in his locality.

Bonifacio is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farm and his harvest.

Bonifacio hopes to make his business a success and save money for reinvestment in the business.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 61 years old and supports her children. Her farming business is doing well, and her monthly income has risen to KES 26,000. She has borrowed KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and wants to use this money to pay the school fees of her child who is in secondary school. The profits she earns from selling her the harvest from her farm will be used to pay the loan and buy farming supplies. Her dream is to become a famous horticulturist and educate her children to greater levels.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón  de 57 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene un negocio de estampados y de venta de papel periódico., su negocio es pequeño pero con un potencial de crecimiento importante, porque poco a poco ha construido una clientela que lo refiere y esto hace que  se sienta muy estimulado a crecer. Su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a sueño ensanche de su microempresa, por eso está acudiendo a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará   un equipo de estampado, con la cual planea responder oportunamente y de manera efectiva la demanda  de su mercado. Su meta es aumentar el número de contratos de estampados y su mayor desafío es encontrarse a la altura de las empresas de mayor capacidad productiva.
texts.en: Ramon, 57, lives in the city of Cartagena, and he has a printing business where he also sells newsprint paper.  His business is small, but it has significant growth potential, because he has gradually built a customer base and his customers refer him to others.  This makes him very motivated to grow the business.  He doesn't have enough working capital to finance his dream of expanding his business, and so this is why he applied for a Kiva loan.  This is the first financing that he has arranged through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan, he will buy printing equipment so that he will be able to respond promptly and effectively to the demands of the market.  Ramon's goal is to increase his printing contracts; his main challenge is to match the level of companies with greater production capacity.

loans.use: to buy printing equipment

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is a Guatemalan artisan who carries on his parents' tradition of weaving by hand. He specializes in handwoven cotton scarves and handbags. He plans to purchase more yarn so that he can increase production.

Andres has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"When I was eight years old my father thought it was time to learn to weave on a floor loom, just like he did. My products are associated with the history of Guatemala; for example, our ancestors used to place the tortillas in a square holder woven by the women on a backstrap loom. Now, that same tortilla holder is used as a placemat or napkin. I have taught the art of weaving to more than 80 people and now I dedicate most of my time to designing new colors with natural dyes, innovating weaving techniques and supervising apprentices."

"I really appreciated your assistance with the first micro-credit, which helped me buy the materials to develop a number of new designs. We were able to pay it off completely and on time. Now, I'm requesting a second loan to buy weaving materials for the handbags we are creating. Thank you very much for your support, as we hope to expand the number of designs we craft for you."

Use the link below to view Andres's handwoven cotton scarves and handbags on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7431

loans.use: to purchase more yarn so that he can increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for her store.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is a 35-year-old person from Samburu, Kenya. She lives in her own house with her children, aged 17, 15 and 13. All her children are in school; therefore, her monthly major expenditure is school fees. 

She owns a charcoal stall, a business she has been doing for more than three years. She has requested a loan amounting to 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sacks of charcoal. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 57 years old. He is married, and lives with his wife and daughter in the Kvareli District. 

Teimuraz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up, without success. His loan request was rejected every time, due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and 1.5 hectare of agricultural land, where maize is grown.  

Teimuraz is very hard working man. He cultivates the land seasonally before sowing, but the income is too small; it is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to low income. 

With the received credit, Teimuraz will purchase calves, raise them and resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves, then raise and sell them for a higher price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the deteriorated home of her family, for which she needs to buy concrete block, cement, zinc, and wood

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of two sons. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Mahmoud, appears in her Kiva profile photo next to his vegetable stall. 

For the past ten years, Mona's husband has had this vegetable and fruit stall. He sells different types of seasonal fruits and vegetables in the central market where there is good customer movement and high demand to purchase vegetables and fruits. All this makes Mona's husband's business a profitable one. It is the only source of income for the family and sometimes it needs more support to cover its urgent costs.

Mona is requesting a $1,300 US youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of fruits and vegetables to sell. This will increase customers' demand and allow Mona's husband to offer a better selection for his customers to buy, which will improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is 18 years old, and a married woman.  Her husband is a construction worker who earns a low salary, which is barely enough to cover their daily needs.  She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Rana wants to share in making housing improvements with her husband, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of making necessary repairs to their house, such as painting and installing new windows.

Taking this loan will enable Rana and her husband to make suitable improvements so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa vit avec son conjoint artiste et leur seul enfant de 18ans à Lomé. Agée de 40ans, elle exerce comme activité la vente des cartes de recharge et des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’y plait bien dans l’exercice de son activité car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant  de prendre soin de sa famille. Vues que les demandes augmentent et n’arrivant plus à satisfaire les besoins de clients, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour achat des cartes de recharges et des produits d’alimentation générale.  Elle veut ouvrir une boutique car son activité se fait dans une baraque et assurer au mieux aux besoins de sa famille. Elle a une ancienneté de 10ans.
texts.en:
Adjowa lives in Lomé with her husband who is an artist, and their only child, aged 18.  Adjowa is 40 years old and she sells rechargeable phone cards and general food products.  She likes her job because the income it brings allows her to take care of her family.

Faced with an increased demand from her customers, Adjowa can no longer meet their needs.  This is why she is taking this first loan with WAGES and plans to buy rechargeable phone cards and general food products.

Adjowa wants to open a shop, since she currently works in a shed.  She also wants to do her best to meet the needs of her family.  She has ten years of experience in this field.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards and general food products.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana, who is the mother of four children. She has been a single mother, working for her children. Since they are living in a deteriorating house, she is requesting her sixth loan, this one to improve the family's housing situation.  She will purchase materials to start rebuilding some of her house's walls, and to replace her zinc roofing sheets with new ones.

Ana is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs, who came to the organization almost two years ago for a loan to expand her business, a grocery stall. Running her grocery business, she earns income that she uses to help her family, to reinvest in the business, and to make loan payments. She lives in a slum area in San Pedro de Macoris.

Esperanza Internacional is running a program in which most of its clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show reliability in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure while implementing their business loans and attending group meetings.

loans.use: To buy materials to start rebuilding some of her house's walls, and to replace her zinc roofing sheets with new ones.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania tiene 32 años, está casada con Cirilo de 35 años con quien tienen dos  , Kevin de 13 años y Niker de tan solo un añito.Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble.Inicialmente se dedicaba  íntegramente al cuidado de sus pequeños pero hace poco decidió aportar en la economía familiar y por idea de su esposo decidieron abrir un negocio en el primer piso de su vivienda en el cual se dedican a la venta de lubricantes para vehículos , ya que su esposo se dedica a la reparación de vehículos.
Le agrada su trabajo puesto que siempre esta al pendiente de sus hijos y tiene tiempo suficiente para dedicarse a ellos. Con el objetivo de encontrar una mejora en su negocio desea contar con el apoyo de su entidad financiera y surtir su negocio con mas productos y así incrementar la su clientela.
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan a la compra de parcelas y posteriormente rentárlos  a productores de cacao orgánico esperando de esta manera hallar un ingreso extra para el futuro de sus hijos .En esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y proceder con la compra de lubricantes para vehículos asi como tambien lubricantes  para moto lineales que son de alta demanda en su localidad.
texts.en:
Tania is 32 years old. She is married to 35-year-old Cirilo, with whom she has two children: 13-year-old Kevin and 1-year-old Niker. She owns a home constructed out of quality materials. Initially she dedicated herself wholly to looking after her young children, but a little while ago she decided to contribute to the family's finances. At her husband's suggestion, they decided to open a business in the first floor of their home selling vehicle lubricants since her husband makes a living by repairing vehicles.

She enjoys her work since she is always there for her children and she has enough time to spend with them. With the goal of improving her business, she wishes to obtain help from her financial institution and stock her business with more products to increase her clientele.

Her long-term goals include purchasing plots of land and renting them out to producers of organic cacao, thereby obtaining extra income for her children's futures. On this occasion she needs 1,000 PEN to buy vehicle lubricants as well as lubricants for linear motors, which are in high demand in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle lubricants

loans.name: Fatena

texts.en:
Fatena is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online. Therefore her husband, Mohammad, appears in her Kiva profile photo, in her place.  He had his photo taken in the cosmetics store he owns.

Fatena is a 35-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of one son and one daughter, both of them school students. For the past two years, Fatena's husband has had a cosmetics store, which is located in a good commercial area and has many loyal customers. The store has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family, but it needs more support from time to time, to cover the cost of its operation.

Fatena is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN, to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing a new collection of cosmetics to stock his store. This purchase will increase sales and improve the income of Fatena's husband, which will enable him to provide better living conditions to their family.

loans.use: To purchase a new collection of cosmetics to resell in the store

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Jeune  infirmier de 32ans, Yao a pour épouse une revendeuse. Ils ont ensemble 01 enfant de 10 mois. Afin de venir en aide aux populations de  son quartier et de la ville de Lomé, il a crée un mini-cabinet dans lequel il vient en aide aux patients. En plus du soin qu’il apporte à ces derniers,  il vend des produits pharmaceutiques. C’est pour l’achat et la rénovation de son cabinet, qu’il fait son premier crédit à WAGES. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il souhaite agrandir son cabinet, avoir un dépôt de produits pharmaceutiques et construire une maison pour sa famille. Il a une ancienneté de 08ans dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Yao, aged 32, is a young male nurse.  He is married to a reseller and they have a 10-month-old child together.  In order to help the people from his neighborhood and the city of Lomé, he has created a mini practice in which he sees patients.  In addition to treating his patients, he also sells pharmaceutical products.

Yao is taking his first loan with WAGES in order to purchase and renovate his practice.  In the future, he would like to increase the size of his practice, own a warehouse to store his pharmaceutical products, and build a house for his family.  He has eight years of experience in his field of work.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Robinson Jose

texts.es: Robinson vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 5 a 8 años, en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias. Allí se dedica a la fabricación y venta de bollos, amasijo de maíz molido,  envuelto en hoja de esa planta y sometido a cocción, para luego ser  vendido en tiendas y a los vecinos del sector. Su meta de incrementar sus ventas no se detiene y cada día prepara diversas combinaciones de coco, de queso, de plátano y hasta de batata. Su meta mas adelante es mejorar las condiciones locativas y por eso se dedica a trabajar durante 12 diarias con el fin de llegar a alcanzarlas. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación  Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como maíz, pita, queso, plátano maduro etc,  para producir la diversas variedades de su delicioso producto y aumentar su producción, basado en las exigencias del mercado creciente.
texts.en:
