Robinson lives with his wife and their three children, who are between the ages of five and eight, in the city of Cartagena de Indias. He makes a living by making and selling bread rolls. The dough is made from ground maize, which is then wrapped in maize leaves and cooked before being sold in the stores in the district and to his neighbors. His goal is to increase his sales and every day he prepares different combinations of coconut, cheese, plantain and even sweet potato. His most pressing goal is to improve his living conditions and, in order to achieve it, he commits himself to working 12 days in a row.

He is currently applying to Kiva for his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy raw materials and supplies, such as maize, pita, cheese, and ripe plantain to produce the different varieties of his delicious product and increase his production based on the demands of the growing market.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies, such as maize, pita, cheese, and ripe plantain

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es: Ivonne de 32 años de edad, se dedica al diseño y confección de ropa infantil desde hace 6 años, cuando decidió poner su capacidad creativa al servicio  de la comunidad, mediante la confección en a línea infantil,  a la cual agregó posteriormente lencería ,  productos que vende a sus clientes de contado y a crédito, todos los días. En la actualidad su mercado ha crecido gradualmente y lo que recupera por concepto de cuentas por cobrar, no es suficiente para responder oportunamente a su clientela, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas un armario y una fileteadora. Su meta e posicionarse en el mercado local y avanzar hacia el mercado nacional y este sueño con trabajo y persistencia tiene el propósito de lograrlo, aunque trabaje sin el apoyo familiar pero seguro de que sacará adelante su propósito.
texts.en: 32-year-old Ivonne has made a living from designing and making children’s clothing for six years, ever since she decided to put her creative abilities to the service of her community. Later she added lingerie, which, together with the children’s clothing, she sells to her customers every day in cash or on credit. Her market has been growing gradually and she has been operating on accounts receivable, but it is not sufficient to respond appropriately to her clientele. This is the reason she is applying to credikiva for her second financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy fabrics, a closet, and an overlock sewing machine. Her goal is to position herself in the local market and advance to the national market. Her intention is to achieve this dream through work and persistence; although she works without support from her family, she is sure she can achieve her goal..

loans.use: to purchase fabric, a closet, and an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Perpetual cooks banku and serves it with okra soup and fish at Asebu near Cape Coast.  She is married and has five children.  Her husband is a driver. She helps her partner to educate, feed and clothe their children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize, vegetables, fish and other ingredients needed to cook her banku recipe for sale. She will expand her business with the new profits from her increased banku sales.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize, vegetables,  fish and other ingredients needed to cook banku to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and lives in Fatima, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with one child.

To earn a living, Jocelyn owns an eatery/restaurant business. She earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Jocelyn has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her eatery business.

Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to expand her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her eatery business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in a rice farming business together with her husband for several years now. She also runs a small eatery in her place.

Isabel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, Isabel hopes to make her rice farming business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Jenia

texts.en:
Jenia is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children. She has been engaged in rice farming together with her husband for more than five years now. Jenia works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the schooling of their children.

Jenia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for additional labor on the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of their farm and its sustainability. In the future, Jenia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for additional labor on the farm

loans.name: Jesseril

texts.en:
Jesseril is a 27-year-old married man and a father of two young children from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. He runs a sari-sari (variety store) business in his place.

Jesseril needs a loan for his business. He is requesting a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like rice, canned goods, soap, toiletries, chips, snack foods, and soda among other items. With this, he will be able to improve his earnings from his store.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like rice, canned goods, soap, toiletries, chips, snack foods, soda, etc

loans.name: Lizelda

texts.en:
Lizelda is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is  a married woman and the mother of two young children.

Lizelda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.  With this, she will be able to increase the productivity of their farm, thus augmenting their yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
A 53-year-old married woman and a mother of four grown-up children, Lodivina has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than 20 years. This is the source of their income.

Lodivina is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the farm and eventually the harvest. Lodivia dreams of expanding her farm and making it productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is a 55-year-old farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the rice farming business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve their rice field and eventually the harvest, thus augmenting their yield and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two young children. Lourdes works very hard in order to help her husband on their farm and in meeting their needs.

Lourdes is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for the additional labor for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve their farm and its productivity.

Lourdes hopes of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for the additional labor for the farm.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single young man.

For the past four years, Mohammad has had a grocery store selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but also it needs more support to cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar, milk and canned food. This will increase sales and increase Mohammad's income. Mohammad is looking in the future to expand his project to improve his income.

The photo of Mohammad is in his grocery store.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase needed stock of basic groceries

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 37 años, es divorciada y tiene dos hijas, flor de 12 años y Karina de 2 años.Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble .Inicialmente tenía presencia en las actividades económicas tales como la producción de cacao y café orgánico , posteriormente con el apoyo de su ahora ex esposo abrio  una tienda de abarrotes, al cual le dedica todo su esfuerzo con el fin de brindar una calidad de vida a su familia .Su rutina de trabajo empieza desde muy temprano y atiende a vecinos y amigos de su barrio quienes acuden a la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, conservas entre otros. No obstante al ser un negocio muy concurrido posee clientes a quienes les brindo productos al crédito los cuales se demoran en cancelarle el importe brindando perjudicando de alguna manera sus ganancias finales.A manera de surtir nuevamente su negocio desea contar con un capital de trabajo y proceder con la compra de más mercadería esperando así mantener o aumentar la concurrencia de sus clientes.Sus objetivos a corto plazo apuntan a la mejora de su negocio, razón por la cual requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mas mercadería al por mayor de productos no perecibles como arroz, azúcar, conservas de pescado  y cereales.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old and divorced. She has two daughters: Flor, 12 years old, and Karina, 2 years old. She has a home constructed out of fine materials. Initially she had a presence in economic activities like the production of cocoa seed and organic coffee. Then, with the support of her now-ex husband she opened a grocery store, to which she dedicates all of her efforts with the goal of giving a quality of life to her family. Her work routine starts very early and she attends to neighbors and friends in her neighborhood who come to buy high-necessity products like rice, sugar, canned foods, among others. 

However, being a very busy business, she has customers who she provides products on credit, who are late in paying off the price, harming her final earnings. To again stock her business, she wants to have a capital, and proceed with the purchase of more merchandise, hoping to maintain or increase the amount of customers. Her objectives in the short term aim to the improvement of her business, the reason for which she requires having 1000 nuevos soles for the purchase of more merchandise in bulk of non-perishable products like rice, sugar, canned fish, and cereal.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, sugar, canned fish, and cereal.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 38 years old and lives in Kawit, Pagadian City. She is married with one child.

To earn a living, Mirasol has a business selling barbecue. She earns about PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. Mirasol has requested a loan to be used in purchasing meat for her barbecue.

Mirasol has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Mirasol would like to be the meat distributor in every restaurant within the city.

loans.use: to purchase meat for her barbecue

loans.name: Rico

texts.en:
Rico is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He has earned a living through his rice farming ventures for more than four years now. Rico works hard in order to provide the daily needs of his family.

Rico is asking for a loan to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve the farm and eventually his harvest, thus augmenting her yield and profit. In the future, Rico hopes to make his rice farming business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the future schooling of his two young children.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is also engaged in a retailing business running a sari-sari or variety store in her hometown.

Rosalinda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional stocks to sell in her store like canned goods, rice, soda, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and her income. Rosalinda wants to save money to reinvest in the same business and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma earns a living through her food and candy-making business. She lives with her family in Bien Unido, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman. Alma is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients for her food and candy making business like sugar, milk, and butter and to buy fishing nets. In the future, Alma hopes to make her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food and candy making business and to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Sixta Tulia

texts.es: Sixta  de 46 años de edad vive con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su hija de 13 años de edad  en el macroproyecto de vivienda sostenible, Ciudad Bicentenario en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias,  liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Allí encontró la posibilidad de continuar su negocio de fabricación de sandalias, el cual inició hace 8 años y para el cual ha estructurado un mercado conformado por pequeños almacenes, mujeres y vecinos en general. Ella aprendió este oficio cuando acudía  a la iglesia y en compañía de vecinas participantes de la misma comunidad se capacitaron para producir, tal como lo está haciendo actualmente. Sus compras de insumos las realiza en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se traslada semanalmente y el proceso productivo lo realiza en la ciudad de Cartagena en su domicilio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado, plantillas, broches hebillas, capelladas, para fabricar calzado que tiene encargado y requiere cumplir con los pedidos de manera oportuna a su clientela,  lo que hace que su inversión sea todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Sixta is 46 years old and lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and 13-year-old daughter, in the large-scale project of sustainable living, Ciudad Bicentenario in the city of Cartagena de Indias, led by the Foundation of Mario Santo Domingo. There she found the possibility of continuing her business of making sandals, which she started 8 years ago, and for which she has structured a market comprised of small stores, women, and neighbors in general. She learned this skill when she went to church and in the company of participating neighbors from the same community, they were trained to produce, just like she is doing currently. She makes purchases of supplies in the city of Barranquilla, where she goes weekly. She does the productive process in the city of Cartagena in her home. 

Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that the Foundation Mario Santa Domingo is doing, through which she will buy in bulk and in cash, insoles, buckle clasps, toecaps, to make shoes that have been ordered, and she requires to complete the orders in a timely fashion for her customers, which means that her investment will be a success.

loans.use: to buy in bulk and in cash, insoles, buckle clasps, toecaps, to make shoes.

loans.name: Welyneth

texts.en:
Welyneth is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She earns a living through her hog-raising business. She is also into the retailing business by running a small grocery store in her place.

Welyneth is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks for her store like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap and toiletries and feed for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her two ventures, augment her income and profit from it.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her store and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is a 42-year-old married man and a father of four children from San Miguel, Bohol. He earns a living through his motorcycle transport business.

Alexander is asking for a loan to buy spare parts like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, sprockets and fluid. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle.

In the future, Alexander dreams of improving his venture and exploring another business to augment his income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts like wheel tires, nuts and bolts, sprockets and fluid

loans.name: Alvaro Enrique

texts.es: Con su crédito anterior Álvaro compró carne en mayor volumen, surtió su negocio y vendió mucho más. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, para aumentar el volumen de sus compras de carne de res y continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo y con ello su cartera de clientes, para poder generar mas utilidades que beneficien sus familias. Álvaro envía un mensaje “Gracias por su ayuda y que siempre la sigan haciendo.”
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Álvaro bought a greater volume of beef, stocked his business, and sold much more. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan in order to increase the volume of his beef purchases and to continue increasing his working capital - and with that, his clientele – in order to generate more profit that benefits his family. 

Álvaro has this message: “Thank you for your help, and may you always continue to offer it.”

loans.use: to purchase beef.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis con su negocio de comidas rápidas está muy satisfecho, porque con él obtuvo un credikiva que lo invirtió en la compra de un freidor, materia prima como maíz, aceite y en láminas de eternit, con las que mejoró su  locacion. Los clientes están mucho mas cómodos y él se siente muy tranquilo y seguro, porque aumentaron sus ingresos. El envia un mensaje a los finaciadores que dice: " Le doy gracias a esas personas que nos  están apoyando para sacar adelante nuestros negocios y hacerlo crecer. En la actualidad está aplicado a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará una vitrina calentadora, otros planes a celular y materias primas e insumos para aumentar su producción, con la que ganará un poco mas.
texts.en:
Luis is very satisfied with the Kiva loan that he obtained for his fast food business. He purchased a deep fryer and supplies, such as corn and oil. Luis also bought fiber cement panels so that he could make improvements to his shop. His customers are much more comfortable and he feels more secure and at peace because he was able to increase his earnings.

Luis sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: “Thanks to everyone who helps us with moving our businesses forward and making them grow. I am now applying for another Kiva loan so that I can buy a heated display case, as well as supplies and materials in order to increase production. I have other plans to sell mobile phones so that I can earn a little more income.”

loans.use: to buy a heated display case, materials, supplies, as well as mobile phones for starting another business.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
Dave was widowed long ago. She is forty-five years old and has four children who are 23, 20, 19 and 18 years old. They all live in the suburbs of a little town in northern Albania. 

“With my husband passing away, my life became extremely difficult. We were poor when he was alive, yet, following his death we became poorer. The youngest one, the 18-year-old now, was 2 years old then. Years later, I decided to add some dairy cows, believing that the extra milk would give me a little bit of extra income, and it did. I was finally able to feed my four kids and educate them,” Dave said.

Dave now wants to build a stable for her animals and requests a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: to build a stable for her animals.

loans.name: Prena

texts.en:
Prena is in her early sixties. She is a widowed mother of a 27-year-old son. They both live in northern Albania and together run a livestock company.

“It took us a couple years to establish a steady clientele,” Prena said. “The first few years that I was running this activity all on my own, I sold only milk. Five years back, my son and I started making and selling cheese/cottage cheese and salted butter. Our clients are happy with our products and so are we with the income we generate,” she continued saying.
 
A loan of 100,000 ALL will help them build a better and larger stable where they can keep the dried fodder for their animals as well. This loan will be her first one.

loans.use: to build a better stable for her animals.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es: Javier vende artesanías que él mismo produce y con ello le ha ido muy bien desde que recibió su primer financiamiento de Kiva, porque aumentó sus posibilidades de producir, mantuvo inventarios para una mejor exhibición a su clientela y vendió mucho mas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva mediante el cual comprará materiales para la elaboración de bolsos  para comercializar en su local y continuar aumentando su nivel de ingresos
texts.en:
Javier sells handicrafts that he produces himself. He did very well with the first Kiva loan he received since he was able to increase the number items that he produced. As a result, he was able to maintain an inventory of goods that he could display to his customers, which led to more sales.

Javier is currently applying for another Kiva loan so that he can buy materials for producing bags that he can sell in his shop. This will enable him to continue earning more income.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making bags.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 30-year-old man living in the Gurjaani district of Georgia, with his 29-year-old wife Marina and their two children. David works as a driver on the Gurjaani-Tbilisi mini-bus line. He has previously asked for loans from local financial institutions to start up a business, but has always been unsuccessful. The financial institutions rejected him because of his low income and poor living conditions. David’s wife cannot work because she is looking after the babies, so the only source of income for the family is David's small monthly salary. According to Credo's estimations, the family belongs to the "subsistence poor" category. 

David asked for a loan from Credo to start up a family business, and it was approved within the framework of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program is intended to lend capital with soft conditions to the rural poor, so they can start up businesses. They would not otherwise have access to credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

David plans to buy the rights to work on the mini-bus line with the loan, which means that he will not have to pay rent as he is currently doing. He will own the line, and won’t have to share the income with anybody. David should therefore get a higher income than before, and this will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.  David dreams of being able to provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: To buy permeation on the mini-bus line

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a 37-year-old married woman with four children. She works in a shop selling cosmetics and ready-to-wear clothes, and also works in a rice field for extra income.  

Celestina has asked for a loan so she can buy some more cosmetics and clothes for her shop. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business and makes it more successful.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and ready-to-wear clothes to sell in her store

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is a 49-year-old married woman. She has raised and cared for pigs for almost five years now. 

Crispina has asked for a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticdes for the rice field, and feed for the pigs. With this loan, she hopes she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and pesticdes for the rice field, and feed for the pigs

loans.name: Diega

texts.en:
Diega earns a living through her "sarisari", or general store business. She sells various goods to the people in her village. 

Diega has asked for a loan to buy extra groceries to sell like canned goods, rice, candies and snack foods, soda, soap, and toiletries. In the future, Diega hopes to expand her business and makes it sustainable.

loans.use: to buy extra groceries to sell like canned goods, rice, candies and snack foods, soda, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn earns a living through her "sari-sari", or general store business. She lives with her family in Bien Unido, Bohol. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, soap, and toiletries. With these, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store. She hopes that this will add to her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Maribec

texts.en:
Maribec is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She is from San Miguel, in Bohol. Maribec runs a 'sari-sari' or general store business selling food and other goods.

Maribec has asked for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, such as canned goods, rice, candy and snack foods, and soda. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her business and earnings.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, rice, candy and snack foods, and soda.

loans.name: Naneth

texts.en:
Naneth is a 45-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman with four young children.

Naneth has been in the rice farming business with her husband for more than six years now. By working on the rice farm, she helps her husband to meet the needs of their family, especially of the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy extra fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 37-year-old married woman, and the mother of two young children. She is from Bien Unido in Bohol. 

Rosalinda has operated a 'sari-sari', or general store business, for more than ten years now. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, rice, candy, soda, soap and toiletries. Rosalinda hopes to make her business a success in the future so she can save money for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy extra stocks to sell, like canned goods, rice, candy, soda, soap and toiletries

loans.name: La Joie Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vumilia est vice présidente du groupe d'affaire "La Joie". Femme courageuse, entrepreneur, mariée et mère de 12 enfants qui étudient et d'autres ont respectivement leurs propres foyers. Son conjoint est cultivateur. la cliente est vendeuse haricots et autres denrées alimentaires. Son grand défi est lié a la saisonnalité de ses marchandises et a la faillite. la cliente reste optimiste pour un futur meilleur. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d'acheter 2 sacs haricots. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien financier.Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Vumilia is the vice president of the "La Joie" business group. A courageous and entrepreneurial woman, she is married and the mother of 12 children who attend school, and others who have their own households. Her husband is a farmer.

Vumilia sells beans and other food items. Her biggest challenge is due to the seasonal nature of her merchandise and possible bankruptcy. However, she remains optimistic about a better future. This new loan will allow her to buy 2 bags of beans. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for its financial help.

Note: some customers in the picture are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of beans.

loans.name: Yabavi

texts.fr: Mère de 03 enfants âgés de 12,07 et 02ans (deux scolarisés).  Afin de prêter main forte à son conjoint plombier, Yabavi exerce comme activité la vente des articles de mercerie et des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle le fait seule dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Elle sollicite acheter des articles de mercerie et des produits d’alimentation générale c’est pour cela, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES. A l’avenir, elle veut construire une maison pour sa famille et rendre son activité pérenne.
texts.en:
Yabavi is a mother of three children who are 12, 7 and 2 years old (two of whom attend school). To help her plumber spouse she runs a business selling haberdashery and grocery products. She is alone in the shop and gets her supplies from Lomé. 

She wants to  buy haberdashery and grocery products which why she is requesting a first credit loan from WAGES. In the future she wants to build a house for her family and make her business sustainable.

loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: Aude Joel

texts.fr: Aude est un homme de 32 ans, célibataire. Actif depuis 03 ans, il vend des beignets dans un quartier de la ville. Il sollicite le crédit pour acheter des matières premières (farine, sucre, levure, accessoires des beignets) pour augmenter son niveau de stock qui est moyen et afin d'accroître son chiffre d'affaires ainsi que son profit. le profit dégagé sera utilisé pour réinvestir dans son activité (congélateur, four, laminoir) et le reste pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille (logement, nutrition et santé)
texts.en:
Aude is a single man who is 32 years old. Active since three years, he sells fritters in one of the city's neighborhoods. 

He is requesting the credit loan to buy raw materials (flour, sugar, yeast, accessories for fritters) to increase his currently medium stock level, so that in turn he can increase his turnover and his profits. 

The profits generated will be reinvested in his business (freezer, oven, mill) and the remainder used to meet his family's needs (housing, nutrition and health).

loans.use: buy raw materials

loans.name: Georges Duplex

texts.fr: Georges est un homme de 30 ans et père de 02 enfants. Activité présente depuis 7 ans, il possède et gère un mini garage où il vend des pneus et répare les pneus dans un quartier de la ville. il sollicite le crédit pour acheter des marchandises (pneus et chambre à air) pour augmenter son niveau de stock et afin d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son profit. le profit dégagé sera utilisé pour réinvestir dans son activité et le reste pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa famille (éducation de ses enfants, nutrition et santé)
texts.en:
George is a 30-year-old man, father of two children. He has been performing this activity for the past seven years: he owns and manages a mini-garage where he sells and repairs tires in one of the city's neighborhoods.

He is requesting a credit loan to buy merchandise (tires and inner tubes) to increase his inventory level, and in turn increase his turnover and profits. 

The generated profits will be reinvested in his business and the remainder used to meet his family's needs (children's education, nutrition and health).

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Valerio

texts.en:
Valerio is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man and has eight children. Valerio is engaged in the buying and selling of farm products like bananas and other crops.
Valerio is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. With this, he will be able to improve his business and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta runs a sari-sari or variety store. She lives with her family in Trinidad, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, toiletries, rice, snack foods and other items.
With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, toiletries, rice, snack foods and other items.

loans.name: Arjana

texts.en:
Arjana is requesting, for the first time, a loan of 200,000 Albanian Lek, to build a stable for her animals and wants to thank all Kiva lenders in advance for their financial help.

Arjana is a 28-year-old married mother of a 7-year-old, school-aged boy and lives in northern Albania. For almost six years, she has been in the dairy/livestock business and the last two and a half years, she has been experiencing tremendous growth.

“My clients have been making positive comments about the cheese I make, and this has made possible the growth of my clientele and an increase in income also. It cheers me up,” said Arjana with beaming eyes.

loans.use: to build an animal stable.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 46 años, esta casada con Andres ,  con quien tiene 4 hijos , ambos poseen una vivienda construida  a base de material noble la cual fue construida con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.La labor de virginia se encuentra en el campo en donde se encarga de la producción de cacao orgánico. Es una labor que desempeño desde niña junto a su familia y se siente orgullosa de seguir con su tradición familiar .Como los años pasan y es necesario mejorar su economía familiar ha decidido abrir una tienda de abarrotes en el primer piso de su vivienda lugar que ahora le sirve como almacén de granos de cacao.
Desea contar con capital para la compra de mercadería y lograr por fin la apertura  de su negocio. Considera que su futuro negocio tendrá una buena acogida puesto que en su barrio existen pocos comercios de ese rubro.
Dentro de sus objetivos a largo plazo se encuentra terminar la construcción del segundo piso de su hogar.Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, agradecida por la oportunidad brindada se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual . En esta oportunidad requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y proceder con la compra de productos al por mayor como arroz, azúcar , conservas enlatadas y productos de limpieza.
texts.en:
Virginia, 46, is married to Andrés and has four children. They own a house which they built with solid material and a lot of effort and dedication. Virginia works in agriculture; she grows organic cocoa. She learned this line of work from her family when she was a girl, and she feels proud to continue with the family’s tradition. Time passes by and the family needs to improve its economic situation, so Virginia has decided to open a grocery store in the ground floor of her house, today used as a storage room for the cocoa beans.

Virginia would like to have enough capital to buy supplies and open her business. She believes it will be successful because there are few stores like this one in her neighborhood.

One of her long-term goals is to finish building the second floor. This is Virginia’s first loan with MFP; she feels grateful for the opportunity and promises to pay the installments on time. She is requesting 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy different supplies in bulk, such as rice, sugar, canned food and cleaning products.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, sugar and canned food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate the computer store he owns.

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
Lene applied for a loan of 250,000 Albanian Lek from VisionFund Albania to build a brand new and good-sized stable for her animals. This will be her second loan from the institution with the previous one being paid successfully.

Lene has been in the livestock business for over thirteen years now. She has been selling milk, baby calves and piglets to the locals and the income she has earned through this activity has helped her to raise and educate her children. Lene is not alone in this, she gets help from her husband.

Lene is sixty years old and married. She has six children with the youngest one being fourteen years old and going to school. They live in a rural village in northern Albania.

loans.use: to build a brand new and good-sized stable for her animals.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es: Eufemia con su crédito anterior mejoró las condiciones habitacionales de su vivienda y ahora está  mas segura, con una mejor imagen y mucha mas clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva,  con el cual comprará un computador para ofrecer el servicio de internet y con ello empieza a aprovechar un mercado desatendido con potencial de expandirse. Eufemia está muy agradecida y quiere hacérselo saber a sus financiadores de Kiva.
texts.en:
With her last loan, Eufemia improved living conditions in her home and is now more established, with a better image and much more customers. 

Today, she is requesting a a new loan from Kiva, which she will use to buy a computer to offer Internet services. This will allow her to tap into a neglected market with the potential to grow. Eufemia is very grateful for the loan and wants the people who give to Kiva to know this.

loans.use: to buy a computer to offer Internet services.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Coiffeur de profession, Kodjo est un jeune homme de 22ans qui n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Il a pour épouse une infirmière. Après sa formation, il a ouvert un atelier dans lequel il sert ses clients et a un apprenti qui l’aide dans l’exécution de ses activités. Afin d’aménager son salon pour attirer plus de clientèle, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour atteindre son objectif. A l’avenir, il souhaite ouvrir un autre atelier et prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a 22-year-old young man and a trained hairdresser. He doesn't have any children in his care, and is married to a nurse.

After finishing his training, he opened a hairdressing workshop where he takes care of his customers. He has an apprentice who helps him with his business.

In order to fit out his workshop and attract more customers, he's seeking a first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES.

In the future, he wishes to open another workshop and take care of his family.

loans.use: to fit out his hairdressing workshop

loans.name: Adzowagan

texts.fr: Adzowagan vit avec son mari et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 15 et 06ans et sont tous scolarisés. Pour aider son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle a démarré l’activité de la vente des boucles d’oreilles, des chaines et divers de façon ambulante. Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé et à COTONOU (Capitale du BENIN). Vues la qualité des produits vendus, elle a plusieurs clients dans la ville et n’arrivant plus à les satisfaire, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle souhaite élargir son activité et prendre soin de l’avenir des enfants. Elle est âgée de 41ans et a une ancienneté de 07ans.
texts.en:
Adzowagan lives in Lomé with her husband and their two children, age 15 and 6. Both go to school. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she started selling earrings and necklaces as a traveling saleswoman.

She gets her supplies in Lomé and in Cotonou, Benin. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has several customers in her city, whom she cannot satisfy anymore. She's therefore seeking a first loan from Kiva's parter, WAGES, in order to resupply.

Her future prospects include expanding her business and ensuring her children's future. She's 41 years old, and has been a seller for seven years.

loans.use: to buy earrings, necklaces, and other items

loans.name: Vitore

texts.en:
Vitore is married, and has four children who are all in school.  She lives in a town in northern Albania, and has been running a bakery for the past eight years. Her clients, the residents of the city where she sells the breads, are content with her products because she doesn’t use yeast; she uses homemade dough instead.

“I am the only one providing an income for my family, and this makes me proud of myself. My husband helps me in the business, as well. I haven’t hired anyone to help me in producing or selling the breads, thus, I very much appreciate my husband’s help,” Vitore said.

The loan she is requesting will help her buy wheat flour.

loans.use: To stock up her bakery with wheat flour.

loans.name: Vullnet

texts.en:
Vullnet is a 53-year-old married father of five school-aged children; they all live in a rural part of central Albania.

Vullnet worked in coal mining for almost ten years. For the last twenty years, he has focused on the agricultural business, since he owned some land. He plants and sells veggies, potatoes, grains, and fruits.  From the sale of his fresh produce, Vullnet says he makes a good income. 

In the future, he wants to create a plum plantation and sell the plums to locals who produce “Raki”, a traditional Albanian drink.

The loan he is requesting now will be used to buy seed, fertilizer, plant/dig the soil, etc.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer,  and plant/dig the soil, etc. on his agricultural land.

loans.name: Sanije

texts.en:
Sanije is fifty four, an Egyptian married mother of four grownup children. They live in a major town within their community.

The loan Sanije is requesting from VisionFund Albania is in the amount of 120,000 Albanian Lek. She will use it for home repairs. The majority of the Egyptian community in this city live under extremely poor conditions; thus, most often our institution gets requests from them to help them out in improving their living conditions. 

For almost ten years, Sanije has been selling used clothing in the local market; yet, with the income she’s been generating, it has been impossible for her to put some money into savings on the side to repair the family home.

loans.use: To repair their family home.

loans.name: Ali Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ali, and it consists of four ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. They are helpful members who have known each other for many years. 

They have applied for a loan of 80,000 YER. Fatima is 36 years old, and the mother of four children who live together in Taiz. She works as henna designer, and offers good services to her clients. She is the breadwinner, and works to earn household expenses for her family. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to buy henna services. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy henna services to use for her business.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa is twenty seven years old, and lives in the rural northern part of the country.  She is married and has two young children who are one and two years old. She, her husband and their children live with her husband's family members.  Together, they all have been running a livestock activity for six years; they sell milk to dairy farms in their vicinity, and baby calves to the locals. 

Working with other members of the family, "it’s much more enjoyable, and easier as well,” Shpresa said. “We are accustomed to this lifestyle here in the rural north, and we very much appreciate the togetherness,” she continued saying, smiling.

Shpresa is requesting a loan to drill a well, and hopes that Kiva lenders will lend to her. This will be her first loan from this institution.

loans.use: To drill a water well.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora a 41-year-old villager, and a Catholic devotee who lives in rural northern Albania.  She is married, and has three children: 12, 10 and 6 years old. 

Flora’s youngest child was born with medical problems, and has been scheduled for a surgery that will take place in Italy at the end of March.  Even though the Catholic Church of Albania has offered to cover most of the medical expenses and traveling, she still needs some more money for this purpose, and this is why she is requesting a loan of a small amount (50,000 Albanian Lek).

Flora has been in the agriculture/livestock activity for the past thirteen years, and she does not complain about the income she’s been earning from it.

loans.use: To cover medical expenses for her six-year-old son's upcoming surgery.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 37 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edson de 39 años y su querida hija de 15 años, a quien desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.El trabajo de Elizabeth consiste en realizar la construcción de mesas, sillas y muebles de madera , esta producción las envía a la capital en donde pagan buen precio, también deja a crédito a tiendas  en donde ya tiene contratos anticipados, empezó vendiendo poco y solo a algunos clientes pero con el tiempo fue ampliando su mercado y ahora cuenta con muchos mas clientes .Le gusta su actividad  porque siente que su trabajo esta dando frutos, lleva más de 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene buenas ventas, con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender ella misma sus productos.Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP y se compromete  a pagar de manera puntual  sus cuotas .En esta oportunidad solicitara 1000 soles para la compra de materia prima que usa para la construcción de mesas, sillas y muebles de madera , ya que últimamente esta teniendo más pedidos por parte de sus compradores.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 37 years old. she is a humble and hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Edson, who is 39, and their beloved daughter, who is 15. She wants to give her a better quality of life. Elizabeth's work is building tables, chairs and other furniture out of wood. She sends her products to the capital where they pay her a good price. She also sells on credit in stores where she has contracts. She started selling little by little and only to a few customers but over time she grew her market and now she has many more customers. She likes her activity because she thinks her work is getting results. She has been doing this activity for more than 5 years and thinks it is going well because she has good sales. Over time, she hopes to have a store where she can sell her own products. This will be loan number 2 with MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. At this time, she will ask for 1000 soles to buy raw materials she will use to build tables, chairs and other furniture out of wood, because lately she has had more orders from her buyers.

loans.use: to raw materials: wood

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan aprovechó la temporada de fin de año, para vender mucho mas y esto fue gracias a su anterior credikiva con el cual compró cervezas por cajas, refrescos y frituras. Sus ventas estuvieron a la altura de su demanda, porque respondió a su clientela para las mas hermosas fiestas familiares Navidad y año nuevo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará materias primas para elaborar comidas y bebida que son sus productos principales y con ellos logra rapidaente su inventario de productos terminados.
texts.en: Juan took advantage of the end of the year to sell a lot more and this was thanks to the previous Kiva loan with which he bought cases of beer, sodas and snacks. His sales were as high as the demand, because he responded to his customers for the beautiful family holidays of Christmas and New Years. Right now, he is applying for a new Kiva loan and he will buy raw materials to make food and beverages, which are his main products. With them, he will quickly grow his inventory of finished products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make beverages and food.

loans.name: Elom

texts.fr: Elom est âgé de 26ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Il est gestionnaire dans une société et en même temps revendeur de cartes de recharge. Son premier  prêt octroyé à WAGES lui servira d’acheter des cartes de recharge qu’il va vendre à ses clients. Comme perspectives d’avenir pour l’activité, il veut ouvrir une boutique dans laquelle il va vendre des cartes de recharge et des produits d’alimentation générale. Il veut aussi assurer au mieux son avenir et avoir une famille.
texts.en: Elom is 26 years old. He is single and has no children to support. He works for a company as an administrator and also sells prepaid charge cards. His first loan granted by WAGES will allow him to buy prepaid charge cards to sell to his customers. His future plans for his business include opening a shop in which he will sell prepaid charge cards and groceries. He wants to ensure a better future for himself, and start a family.

loans.use: to buy prepaid charge cards.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Monsieur ADAMA est vers 1973 à LOULOUNI. Père de quatre enfants et marié à une femme, il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à  LOULOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités d’achats et  de ventes des utensiles de menage en plastique et en aluminium depuis plus de 6 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes, notamment des tasses, assiettes, bouilloires ,seaux, baignoires etc. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, ik rentre en  collaboration avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso y’a plus de 3 ans, il est à son cinquième cycle maintenant, tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des douzaines de tasses, bouilloires, d’assiettes et de baignoires. Il s’approvisionne à SIKASSO. Acheminés à LOULOUNI, les articles sont stockés dans son magasin. Il  les revend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à Loulouni et ses environs. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 105 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Adama was born around 1973 in Loulouni. He is married and the father of 4 children. He lives in a traditional family setting in Loulouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He has been buying and selling plastic and aluminium household items for over 6 years. His experience in his line of work has earned him a good reputation and enabled him to receive a lot of orders, particularly for items like cups, plates, kettles, buckets and bathtubs. He started working with Soro Yiriwaso over 3 years ago in order to get the resources necessary for him to be able to satisfy his customers, and is now on his 5th loan. All the previous loans have been correctly repaid.

This loan will allow him to buy dozens of cups, kettles, plates and bathtubs. He gets his supplies from Sikasso town. Having been transported back to Loulouni, the items are stored in his shop. He sells them for cash or credit to a customer base composed of men and women from Loulouni and the surrounding area. Thanks to this loan, he expects to make an average monthly profit of 105 000 francs. These profits will enable him in part to pay off his loan interest, whilst the rest is reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of cups, kettles, plates and bathtubs for resale.

loans.name: Katty

texts.es: Katty, de 37 años esta casada con José con quien tiene 02 hijos de 10 y 07 años de edad , vive junto a su familia en una casa propia . El trabajo de Katty consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir , productos de belleza entre otros razón por la cual se dirige a la casa de los amigos, vecinos y familiares. Lleva realizando su trabajo desde hace dos años y lo hace sola.Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite tener tiempo para su familia, además que le permite aportar en la economía de su hogar, desea poder seguir trabajando y comenzar a ampliar su negocio vendiendo también calzado para niños, pero por el momento se concentra solo en mantenerse en está actividad y mas adelante agrandar su negocio.Este será el segundo crédito con Kiva, esta a la expectativa de que le brinden un apoyo para así poder seguir haciendo su trabajo y cumplir con sus metas, por otro lado se compromete a pagar de manera puntual.Con el monto de 1500 soles, comprará mercadería como ropas para niños , adultos y artículos de librería,  para seguir vendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en: Katty is 37 years old. She is married to José, with whom she has two children, aged 10 and 07. She lives with her family in a home they own. Katty's work consists of selling clothing, beauty products and more. To do this, she goes to the homes of friends, neighbors and relatives.  She has been doing this work for two years and she works alone. She likes her work because it allows her to contribute to her family's budget. She wants to be able to keep working and start expanding her business, selling children's shoes as well. At the moment she is concentrating on maintaining herself in this activity and in the future expanding the business. This will be her second Kiva loan and she hopes to get support to keep doing her job and achieve her goals. She is also committed to making her payments on time. With the amount of 1500 soles that she has asked for, she will buy merchandise such as children's and adult's clothing and book store products, so she can keep selling to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children and adults.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Veuve de 55ans, Akossiwa a un enfant de 29ans. Elle a démarré en 2011 son activité de tissus coupons à domicile. Afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des tissus coupons. Avec le bénéfice qu’elle va réaliser, elle veut ouvrir une boutique et assurer ses propres besoins.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 55-year-old widow and has one 29-year-old child. She started her fabric cutting sales business in her home in 2011. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy fabric cuttings so that she can better satisfy her customers. She would like to use the profits she earns to open a shop and take care of her needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric cuttings.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Jeune homme dynamique de 26ans, Kokouvi se bat chaque fois pour avoir son pain quotidien. Il n’est pas marié et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, il exerce comme activité la vente des pièces détachées depuis 2010 dans une boutique. C’est pour le renforcement de son activité qu’il sollicite ce premier crédit à WAGES. Il espère réinjecter les profits dans son activité, assurer ses besoins primaires et construire plus tard sa maison.
texts.en: A young, dynamic 26-year-old man, Kokouvi has to fight for his daily bread. He is single and has no dependent children. He has been selling spare parts in a shop since 2010 so that he can meet his needs. He is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to strengthen his business. He hopes to reinvest some profits into his business, take care of his basic needs and, one day, build a house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: José Nelson

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde su niñez se dedica a la agricultura; fue su padre quien le enseño esta actividad, para llevar el sustento a su familia. Hoy en día esa es una de sus fuentes de ingresos; ya que se dedica también a trabajar en las fincas de café cortando y podando las cosechas. En esta cosecha que paso le fue un poco mal, debido a la plaga y no pudo sacar la cosecha esperada y no cubrió todas sus obligaciones.

Para comprar los materiales que necesita para su trabajo, debe de viajar a la ciudad más cercana que esta a ocho kilómetros. Él camina tres kilómetros a pie por un cerro hasta llegar a la parada de autobuses y ah debe esperar unas cuantas horas para que pase el autobús, debido a que el transporte es bastante escaso y para trasladar los materiales los hace cargándolos en su espalda hasta llegar a su casa. 

El prestamos que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4,000 tejas, pago de mano de obra para terminar de construir su casa. Así, podrá terminar de construir su casa antes de que empiece el invierno y que sea un lugar acogedor para sus hijos y tendrán un lugar propio donde vivir, ya que actualmente vive junto a su hermana.
texts.en:
José, 36, is married and has three children. Taught by his father, he has worked in agriculture since he was just a kid, an activity that has helped him bring food to his family’s table, and that still today is one of his sources of income. He also works in coffee farms, picking coffee and trimming the trees. Last season was not good for him due to a plague that affected the crops; he could not cover all his expenses.

In order to buy all the materials he needs for his job, José travels to the closest city, located eight kilometers away. He walks three kilometers up a hill to the bus stop and must wait for several hours for the bus to come, since transport is infrequent. He has to carry all the materials on his back all the way home.

José is requesting a loan to Fundación Campo to buy 4,000 roof tiles and to pay for the labor cost needed to finish building his house. This way, he will be able to finish his house before the raining season comes, and to give his children their own, cozy space where to live. They are now living with José’s sister.

loans.use: to finish his roof before the raining season comes. He will buy 4,000 roof tiles and pay for the labor cost.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila wants to buy ten sheep that will be an addition to her existing herd.

Dila, who resides in the suburbs of a little town in the rural north, is in her sixties and married. She has seven children, all grownups now. For almost twenty-something years, she has been practicing a livestock business that has been the only source of income for her large-sized family.

 “I raised all my children with the income I earned from this activity that I wouldn’t have otherwise. My children have been helping me, too, since we still all live together. This type of industry needs many hands, and this is the beauty of living and working together,” Dila said, all happy.

loans.use: to add ten more sheep to the existing herd

loans.name: Xhevrije

texts.en:
Xhevrije, this wonderful Egyptian sixty-five-year-old widowed mother of eight children and twenty grandchildren, has applied for a loan from VisionFund Albania to rebuild an animal stable. Kindly note that she’s been photographed here with two of her grandchildren, who she adores. 

Xhevrije is respected by everyone in the rural village in northern Albania where they reside. “Even though life has been tough on her, coming from the vulnerable ethnicity community and being widowed in her forties, she still kept working all day to raise her children without complaining at all. Many of us offered Xhev some help when her husband passed away and she accepted it graciously. Her children are hard-workers, too,” said someone in her village.

loans.use: to rebuild her animal stable

loans.name: Selvije

texts.en:
Selvije has been planting and selling fresh agricultural produce at the local market of a main city for the past fifteen years. In addition, she’s been renting a field that is used for soccer games by children in their village. “I have my husband to help me out. We plant and harvest together, and we take turns to go to the market,” Selvije said. “We plan to create some greenhouses very soon,” she added, beaming.

Selvije is forty-eight-years-old and married with two children, twenty-two and eighteen years old, who attend their respective schools. 

A loan of 100,000 Albanian lek will help her to build a fence around the field where she plants.

loans.use: to build a fence around the field where she plants

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Alpha.  He is married and has 5 children aged 30, 27, 25, 22 and 18 years. Three are school-going children. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him to be fostered.

In 1993 Alpha established his cement, paint, shovel, hammer, nails, erosion, bulbs, binding wire, etc., business. He began his business because he was unprivileged to attend school.  He used to assist people and whatever amount was given to him, he kept it.  He accumulated this money and started to sell clear-mint sweets.

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 2,403,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Alpha requires a loan in order to purchase cement, binding wire and nails. In the future, Alpha plans to open another shop and educate his children.  This loan will help to improve the business.  Inadequate capital is his major challenge. He is a hardworking business man.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cement, binding wire and nails

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Aminata, a married mother of a 10-year-old attending school. She has three additional dependents who live with her to assist in household work and business.

In 2003, Aminata established her baby clothing and toiletries business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,033,000 every month. Having already received and repaid a loan, Aminata is requesting a loan for Le 4,500,000 to buy flasks - 20 pieces, bathing bowls - 30 pieces, pampers - 10 cartons, powdered - 24 pieces, Vaseline - 24 pieces, baby walker - 5 pieces, baby's wear - 50 pieces and baby panties - 50 pieces.

Aminata has not opened a shop because of the high cost of rent; instead she concentrates on improving her business. Her living standard has improved, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy flasks - 20 pieces, bathing bowls - 30 pieces, pampers - 10 cartons, powdered - 24 pieces, Vaseline - 24 pieces, baby walker - 5 pieces, baby's wear - 50 pieces and baby panties - 50 pieces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted hair weaves, spray, cream perfume, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.es:
Yohana tiene 33 años , es soltera y tiene 1 hijo de tan solo 1 añito por quien se esmera al máximo.Posee una vivienda de material noble que le fue cedida por sus padres. Tras su divorcio tenia que contar con un ingreso para su pequeña familia y es por eso que con el apoyo de su madre logro aperturar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes .Comenta que es un negocio familiar muy bueno puesto que puede estar al pendiente de su menor hijo así como trabajar con el esmero que la caracteriza.
En su negocio podemos hallar diversos productos para la ama de casa y para el complemento de su negocio posee una congeladora automática en donde ofrece  bebidas heladas como refresco de maracuya la cual tiene muy buena demanda .Tiene como objetivo a largo plazo, iniciar la construcción del tercer piso de su hogar para así alquilarlo y generar ingresos fijos para el futuro.En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1000 nuevos soles y proceder a la compra de productos al por mayor tales como jabones , escobillar , detergentes entre otros porductos del hogar a su vez se muestra agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado y se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Yohana, 33, is single and has a child who's just a year old for whom she makes the maximum effort.  She has a house made of high-quality materials that her parents gave to her.

After her divorce she had one income for her small family, so she opened a small grocery store with the support of her mother.  She says it's a family business in a good location where she can look after her young child as well as work with her characteristic effort.

In her business she sells various products for the housewife.  To complement her business she has an automatic freezer where she sells cold beverages such as passionfruit soda, which is in great demand.

Her long-term goal is to start building the third floor of her house to rent and generate a fixed income for the future.

Currently she wants to have 1000 nuevos soles [PEN] to continue buying products wholesale such as soap, brushes, detergent, and other household products.

She's grateful for the financial support offered and is committed to making her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She has two children who are in school. Alicia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, snack foods, etc. In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business and finish her children's education through college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is a conservative woman so she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead.  She is a 58-year-old housewife and a mother of three. Farida has a handicraft business, making baskets and tissue boxes from straw. She now wants to start making other stuff using straw, like mirror frames, tables, etc., and for that she has applied for this loan to buy some raw materials to start making the pieces.

loans.use: to buy some raw materials.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 63-year-old widow. She recently married off one of her sons and is currently living with her other two sons and her daughter. To help in supporting the family and paying the household bills, she opened a small grocery market at home where she sells mostly food products. Now Sarah is applying for another loan to buy more food products and add more cleaning products.

loans.use: to buy more food products and add more cleaning products.

loans.name: Raeda

texts.en: Raeda used her previous loan to buy a few tools and some cosmetics products that she has already sold. Now her husband has started working in another job besides his current job to maintain good living conditions. Now Raeda is applying for another youth loan to buy more tools for hairstyling and enhance her home business.

loans.use: to buy more tools for hairstyling.

loans.name: Hasibah

texts.en: Hasiba is a 62-year-old married woman. All of her sons and daughters are married except one who is living with her now. Hasibah has a small home business selling blankets, and it helps in bringing in some income to pay part of the monthly household bills. She is now applying for a loan to buy more bed covers in different sizes.

loans.use: to buy more bed covers in different sizes.

loans.name: Mario Gabriel

texts.es:
Mario es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero,  vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Mario pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Mario trabaja asistente comercial en una empresa de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Mario se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una laptop, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder hacer sus informes y trabajos, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
21-year old Mario is single and lives in the town of Ica with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire to get ahead in life. Thanks to his own efforts and support from his parents, Mario was able to study Business Administration.

In his free time he likes to read and on occasion he will cook a delicious ‘lomo saltado’ to share with his family. On his own initiative, and with much hard work and commitment, Mario works as a business assistant for a local enterprise. He works every day starting early in the morning for approximately eight hours. He enjoys this work and believes all is going well because he carries out his duties well and treats people in a friendly manner.

Mario is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy a laptop. It will help him a great deal with reports and other work. He will be able to continue working hard and fulfilling his dream of owning a house. Through small steps he wishes to make progress in life.

loans.use: buy a laptop

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 45-year-old mother of 5 boys and girls. She has a medium size beauty salon where she offers the services of hairstyling. Now she wants to start a wedding dress rental business as part of her salon business, and for that she applied for this loan to buy a few wedding dresses and gowns.

loans.use: to buy a few wedding dresses and gowns.

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en: Myassar is a conservative married woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Myassar has a home based day care that brings her a small monthly income. Her husband, on the other hand, started selling kitchenware and other home products after his retirement. Today Myassar is applying for a loan to help her husband bring more home products to the shop.

loans.use: to bring more home products to the shop.

loans.name: Alba Rocio

texts.es:
Alba vive en Guayaquil, su negocio es la venta de helados , cyber y cabinas. Ella empezo su negocio con la elaboracion de helados de paila poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio y decidio invertir en unas computadoras para ponerce un cyber. Actualmente ella realiza el trabajo con la ayuda de su hijo mayor gran parte de tiempo.

La dificulta de Alba para atender su negocio son las enfermedades es viuda tiene un hijo de 19 años de edad. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar monitores, cpu, camras para tener mas maquinas y poder tener mas clientes. Su sueño es podre mejorar su negocio y poder expandir para asi darle lo mejorf a su familia .
texts.en:
Alma lives in Guayaquil.  Her business is selling ice-cream, a cybercafé, and telephone booths.  She started her business by making fruit sorbets.  She was increasing her business little by little, and she decided to invest in some computers in order to set up a cybercafe.  

She now works most of the time with the help of her grown child.  The difficulty that Alba has in tending her business is illnesses.  She is a widow, and she has a 19 year old child.

She wants to use the loan to buy monitors, CPUs, and cameras.  She wants to have more machines to be able to have more customers.  Her dream is to be able to improve her business and to be able to expand in order to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy monitors, CPUs, and cameras.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is a 41-year-old mother of one son. During the daytime she works as a cleaner in a school. After that she works at sewing and tailoring at home to maintain good living conditions for her son. Sahar is applying for this loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22-year-old single guy. He has two brothers and two sisters. Ali still goes to the university, and he is applying for this educational loan to be able to pay his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Soledad Rosantal

texts.es:
Soledad es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama  y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño, ya que ella es madre y padre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Soledad no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura  y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño,  dedicación y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Soledad trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende diversas prendas de vestir tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Soledad se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de un pequeño baño, el cual será de mucho bien para ella y su familia, ya que podrán tener servicios higiénicos adecuados, que brinden mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Soledad seguirá trabajando y esforzándose lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Soledad is a 27 year old woman who lives in the city of Huaraz with her young son, who she loves and is her main reason for living. She is a very friendly person, hard working and enthusiastic and she dedicates all her energy into getting her son ahead in life, as she is both mother and father to him. Unfortunately due to lack of economic resources and the need to work, Soledad was not able to study the professional nursing career she would have liked. In her free time she likes to spend a little time reading and at times she cooks a delicious rice dish (Chaufa) to share with her family.

With hard work, dedication and thanks to the support of her mother, Soledad works in a small business selling clothes. She sells various items of clothing for women, men and children. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and she thinks it is going well due to her reasonable prices and the kindness with which she treats her customers.

Soledad is very grateful for the Kiva loans, as thanks to the help received she will be able to build a small bathroom. This will be good for her and her family as they will be able to have adequate hygienic facilities, which will give more safety and well-being to them. Soledad will continue working and making an effort to fulfil her dream of extending her business.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal, is the 34-year-old mother of a baby boy. She has a small food market at home, where she sells mostly food products and few cleaning products. In the future, she wants to separate her business from her home. But now she is applying for a loan to bring more goods to the store.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell at her home-based food market.

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en: Gharam is a 21-year-old single woman, a university student majoring in Managerial Information Systems. She is applying for this loan to pay for her upcoming registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the upcoming registration and semester fees for her university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en: Ammar is a young man, 21 years old. He is a hard worker who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has operated a motorbike transportation service as his main source of income, earning enough to cover his daily expenses. He would like to increase his services to customers and increase his profits, which is why he is taking out a youth loan from AMB to buy a new motorbike. In the future, he wants to expand his business. He hopes to own a taxi and a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike and increase his profits from transportation services.

loans.name: Binita

texts.en: Binita is a 52-year-old married women with three children. She is from Rajdevi, Kalaiya, in the Bara District of Nepal. She has photocopy business in her town. Most of the customers in her area come to her shop for their photocopying. Her business is performing well. She is applying for a loan of NPR 40,000 to buy a photocopy machine, so she can meet the ever-increasing demand from her customers. She hopes that her business will expand, to provide support for the needs of her family and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a photocopy machine, so she can sell more photocopy services to her customers.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en: Uma is a 53-year-old married women with three sons, from Rajdevi, Kalaiya Municipality, in the Bara District of Nepal. She is married to Rupnarayan. Both husband and wife have been involved in the livestock business for five years. They visit different villages and buy cows and calves to resell at higher prices. She has applied for a loan of NPR 20,000 from Nirdhan Utthan Bank, to be used exclusively to expand her cow trading business. She has been associated with Nirdhan for a long time. Uma’s earlier days were ones of hardship. But since the establishment of the cow business and her association with Nirdhan, she has been able to buy a plot of land with the business profits, and their family’s standard of living has improved. She has a plan to scale up her cow trading business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows for her trading business.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
Hermelinda es otra integrante del grupo de Nuevo Horizonte, ella tiene la edad de 34 años, solo asistió a la secundaria y es madre soltera de un par de mellizas que estudian la secundaria. 

Ella platica que aprendió a trabajar desde pequeña para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar pero desde que nacieron sus hijas tuvo que trabajar mas duro para sacarlas adelante ya que tenia su propia familia por quien ver y los gastos eran doble ya que son mellizas. Al principio tenía un empleo fijo pero necesitaba tener mas tiempo libre para a tender a sus hijas y fue hace dos años cuando decidió iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio y ganarse  su propio dinero. Ella realiza ventas de cosméticos de casa en casa con sus amigas y vecinas de su comunidad en algunas ocasiones sale a vender a comunidades cercanas. Debido a que ya tiene un tiempo realizando estas ventas, Hermelinda ha ganado buenos clientes lo cual ayuda a que sus ventas sean mayores y pueda ofrecer a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida. Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de esmaltes, delineadores, labiales, sombras, desodorantes y perfumes.
