Sus planes a futuro son para sus hijas ya que le gustaría que tuvieran la oportunidad de estudiar una profesión.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son: 
Lourdes venta de pollo,
Josefina venta de reposteria, 
Bartola venta de antojitos, 
Benigno club de nutricion,
Carmen venta de antojitos,
Heriberta venta de ropa,
Hilda venta de antojitos
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 34, is another member of the Nuevo Horizonte group.  She only attended secondary school and she's the single mother of twin daughters in secondary school.

She says she learned to work from a young age to help with the household expenses.  Since her daughters were born, however, she had to work harder to get them ahead because she had her own family to care for and the expenses were double since they're twins.

In the beginning she had a fixed job but she needed more free time to care for her daughters, so two years ago she decided to start her own business and earn her own money.  She sells cosmetics door-to-door to her friends and neighbors in her community.  Sometimes she goes to nearby communities.  Because she has been doing this work for some time, Hermelinda has acquired good customers, which helps her have greater sales and give her daughters a better quality of life.

She'll invest this loan in buying nail polish, eyeliner, lipstick, eye shadow, deodorant, and perfume.

Her plans for the future are for her daughters because she would like them to have the opportunity to study for a profession.

The other members of the group are Lourdes, chicken sales; Josefina, pastry sales; Bartola, snack sales, Benigno, nutrition club; Carmen, snack sales; Heriberta, clothing sales; and Hilda, snack sales.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

location.town: Zona Urbana Ejidal, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oax

loans.name: Punam Devi

texts.en: Punam Devi is a 35-year-old, married woman with four sons. She lives in Panitanki Chowk in the Bara district of Nepal. She has a small cosmetics shop where she sells different types of ladies cosmetic items. She is satisfied with the current status of the business, but wants to expand this to meet the increasing demand of the customers. She has requested the NRS 40,000 loan with Nirdhan to expand her business so that she can diversify the cosmetic products offered in her store. She has become a role model to other women in her area. She has plans to be the leading cosmetics store in the area.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her shop.

loans.name: Sabita Devi

texts.en: Sabita Devi is a 43-year-old married woman with two sons and one daughter. They live in Panitanki Chowk, in the Bara district of Nepal. She has set up a clothing business where she sells different types of clothes. As a women entrepreneur she has been successful in the business and has earned respect in her locale. She wanted to expand the business by making the clothes store bigger with a wider variety of clothes. She has taken the loan of NRS 40,000 to carry out this expansion. It is unconventional in her area to have entrepreneurial ventures by the women. But she has proved she can succeed with hard work, dedication and creativity. She wants to continue to expand her business in the future and be a leading clothes store in the market.

loans.use: to buy clothes and expand her clothing store.

loans.name: Yorch

texts.es:
Yorch es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a su padres, Yorch no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Veterinaria, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yorch trabaja en una granja, como encargado de la crianza de pollos, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas,  él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yorch se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña refrigeradora y cocina, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder conservar y preparar de manera saludable sus alimentos, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y así poco a poco desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Yorch is a 20 year old man who is single and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly person, who is hard working and enthusiastic. He has a great desire to exceed himself. Unfortunately due to lack of economic resources and the need to work in order to help his parents out, Yorch was not able to study the professional Veterinary career he would have liked. In his free time he likes to play football and sometimes he cooks a delicious chicken and rice dish to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with hard work and dedication, Yorch works on a farm as the manager of raising chickens. He works every day from the early hours of the morning for approximately 10 hours. He feels comfortable carrying out his work and think things are going well thanks to his good performance and friendliness towards others. 

Yorch is very grateful for the Kiva loans, as thanks to the help received he will be able to buy a small refrigerator and a cooker. These will help conserve and prepare healthy food. Yorch will continue working and making an effort to fulfil his dream of having his own house and gradually get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a cooker.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
Sameh is 48 years old and married with 4 daughters. His wife is a nurse.
After his retirement from the military he opened a fruit and vegetable shop. Now Sameh is applying for a loan to add more stalls and buy more fruit.

loans.use: to add more stalls and buy more fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more goods in his store.

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto de 63 años habita al sur de la ciudad donde se dedica ala preparación y venta de comidas rápidas y frituras, negocio que inició hace 2 años después de haber leído un libro sobre aptitud mental positiva, el cual lo inspiró a realizar una actividad diferente a su profesión y fue así como se inclinó en ofrecer el servicio de alimentos, directamente entre vecinos transeúntes y referidos por este mercado. Su meta es abrir otro punto de atención para generar empleos para sus familiares que necesitan ingresos  y quiere tener esa oportunidad de apoyar su bienestar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como salsas, embutidos, cárnicos, lácteos y  harina de trigo, compra con la cual ganará descuentos por realizarla en un mayor volumen que el acostumbrado y esto aumentará su capacidad productiva, para impactar nuevos mercados.
texts.en:
Dagoberto is 63 years old and lives in the south of the city where he makes a living preparing and selling fast and fried foods. He started this business two years ago after reading a book about positive mental attitudes, which inspired him to carry out a different activity to his profession. That was how he began in his food service, directly through commuting neighbours and indirectly through this market.

His goal is to open a service point in order to generate employment for his family members who need the income and he would like to have this opportunity to support their well being. Presently he is requesting a loan, his first loan cycle with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy raw materials and supplies such as sauces, cold meats, meat and dairy products, and wheat flour. With this purchase he will earn discounts by buying in bulk and this will increase his productive capacity and help enter new markets.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies such as sauces, cold meats, meat and dairy products, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ramon Aristides

texts.es:
Ramón es un hombre de 45 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Ramón no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero gracias a su esfuerzo se encuentra se estudiando la carrera técnica de computación, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones come un riquísimo Pollo a la brasa para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ramón trabaja como vigilante, brindando servicios de seguridad en una fábrica de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.  
Ramón se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder hacer sus trabajos y practicas académicas, así pues Ramón seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ramón is a 45 year old man who is single and lives in the city of Ica. He is a very friendly person, who is hard working and enthusiastic. He has a great desire to exceed himself. Unfortunately due to lack of economic resources and the need to work in order to pay his bills, Ramón was not able to study a professional career, but thanks to his dedication he is currently studying a technical computing career. In his free time he likes to disconnect watching television and sometimes he cooks a delicious grilled chicken dish to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with hard work and dedication, Ramón works as a security guard, offering a security service to a factory in his city. He works every day for approximately 12 hours and thinks things are going well thanks to his good performance and friendliness towards others. 

Ramón is very grateful for the Kiva loans, as thanks to the help received he will be able to buy a computer. This will help him do his work and academic practice. Ramón will continue working and making an effort to fulfil his dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Ne'ma

texts.en:
Ne’ma is 35 years old and the married mother of seven sons and daughters. She is a farmer who receives a small monthly salary. Ne’ma started selling blankets at home in addition to her work as a farmer. 

Ne’ma is requesting a loan to purchase new blankets and bed covers in different sizes in addition to what she has.

loans.use: to purchase new blankets and bed covers

loans.name: Las Azucenas De Pueblo Nuevo Group

texts.es: Anayeli tiene 19 años de edad es una chica que aún vive con sus papás y estudia la preparatoria abierta los sábados para tener tiempo para ayudar en casa con las labores del hogar. Platica que es la primera vez que pide un crédito y que las amigas de su mamá la animaron para que entrara al grupo Las Azucenas de Pueblo Nuevo. Le comentaron que le habían puesto ese nombre al grupo porque en su casa su mama tiene un jardín muy grande con flores de azucenas. Ana, como es conocida, puso hace un año una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para poder trabajar en la semana y estar al pendiente de su casa y de sus hermanitos ya que sus papas salen a trabajar y también para ayudarse a pagar las colegiaturas de la preparatoria. Ana pide a VisionFund un crédito para surtir un poco mas de todo lo que vende como huevo, leche, papel higiénico, aceite para cocinar, pañales, azúcar, sal, huevo, atún, servilletas, refrescos, galletas y un poco de dulces para vender de todo un poco, platica que los días sábados va a una tienda de su población donde le vende por mayoreo y le dan precios bajos, dice más adelante quiere vender carnes frías y meter diferentes lácteos, dice que terminando de estudiar la prepa quiere meterse a estudiar para educadora ya que sería uno de sus más grandes logros. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Alma Isabel, Gabriela, Marisela, Fabiola, María Isabel, Irma, Adelina y Jarintzi ellas invertirán en la compra de colchas para vender, en la compra de insumos para elaborar pan, para surtir tienda de abarrotes, comprara pollo muerto para venderlo por kilos, para la compra de cosméticos y perfumería para vender y para surtir zapato para dama y caballero para su venta.
texts.en:
Anayeli is 19 years old.  She is a young woman who still lives with her parents and studies in an “open” high school (an alternative adult school) on Saturdays in order to have time to help at home with the household chores.  She says that it is the first time that she has asked for a loan and that friends of her mother encouraged her to enter the group “Las Azucenas de Pueblo Nuevo” (Pueblo Nuevo Easter Lilies).  They commented to her that they had given that name to the group because in her home her mother has a very big garden with lily flowers.  

Ana, as she is known, put a grocery store in her house about a year ago in order to be able to work during the week and keep an eye on her home and on her younger siblings since her parents go out to work and also to help pay the tuition fees of the high school.  Ana is requesting a loan from VisionFund to stock a little bit more of everything that she sells like eggs, milk, toilet paper, oil for cooking, diapers, sugar, salt, eggs, tuna, napkins, soft drinks, cookies and some candy in order to sell a little bit of everything.  She says that on Saturdays she goes to a store in her town where they sell wholesale and give her low prices.  She says that later on she wants to sell cold cuts and put in different dairy products.  She says that upon finishing her high school studies she wants to go into studying to be an educator because it would be one of her greatest achievements.  

The other members of the group are Alma Isabel, Gabriela, Marisela, Fabiola, María Isabel, Irma, Adelina y Jarintzi.  They will invest in the purchase of bedspreads to sell, in the purchase of supplies to make bread, to stock a grocery store, to buy chicken to sell by the kilo, to buy cosmetics and perfumes to sell and to stock shoes for women and men to sell.

loans.use: to buy eggs, milk, toilet paper, oil for cooking, diapers, sugar, salt, tuna, napkins, soft drinks, cookies and some candy.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 38-year-old conservative woman and she has asked her husband to appear in the photo in her place. The couple have two sons and two daughters. Her husband works in a factory during the day and in the evenings he sells birds from home. Now Manal wants to support her husband and buy more types of birds to sell, so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: buy more types of birds to sell

loans.name: Nadhir

texts.en:
Nadhir is a 28 year old young man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He decided to start his own business and opened a grocery store. He has been operating his store for many years and employs two people. 

Nadhir has fought against adversity his whole life. However, he is a friendly person and always has a smile for his customers. He wants to increase the store's sales so he can prosper financially and offer his family a better future.

In order to increase sales at his store, Nadhir plans to buy more products and offer more variety for his customers. He doesn't have enough capital right now to expand his inventory.  He is requesting a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB. The loan will allow him to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, flour, beans and soft drinks to sell at his store, which will increase sales. He hopes that the extra income that he will generate can provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy basic products such as rice, sugar, flour, beans and soft drinks to sell at his store.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. For the past two years, he has been operating a book shop. Ali started his business with limited capital and now has some regular customers and is quite preferred in the area because he always strives to keep a variety of products in his store so that his customers will always find what they are looking for. Lately, he’s noticed that competition has become quite fierce. As this business is his main source of income, he always wants to stay one step ahead of his competition. 

Ali is requesting a 300,000 YER youth loan from AMB to buy stationary products such as pens, books, notebooks, dolls, and other items to help keep his clientele and attract new customers. In the future, he hopes to attain better living conditions and be able to maintain his business for a long time.

loans.use: to buy stationary products such as pens, books, notebooks, dolls, and other items

loans.name: Baydaa

texts.en:
Baydaa is a 33-year-old married woman whose husband is a private-sector employee. She started a business selling accessories and later started making pickles to order. 

Baydaa is requesting a loan to buy vegetables to make more pickles. She wants to expand her pickle business and make greater quantities of pickles. In the future, Baydaa hopes to open a store to sell fruits, vegetables, and pickles.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to make pickles

loans.name: Sariya

texts.en:
Sariya is a 54-year-old woman with two children. She is a conservative woman and asked her daughter, Azhar, to appear in this photo instead. 

Sariya is requesting a loan to help her pay next semester's fees for Azhar, who is a university student.

loans.use: to support her daughter and pay upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mesaadeh

texts.en: Mesaadeh is 56 years old.  She is a mother to five children, both sons and daughters. In order to help support her family, she sells clothes and makeup products from her home. She is applying for a loan to purchase clothing for the spring season and more makeup products.

loans.use: to bring more spring collection of clothing

loans.name: Gilivazio

texts.en:
Gilvazio is 52 years old and comes from Nyarushanje – Rukungiri District. He is married with eight children.

Gilvazio has a tree planting business in order to protect and preserve the environment. He has been running this for the past four years. He has applied for his second loan from UGAFODE Micro finance Limited (MDI) to enable him to buy more seedlings for planting trees to grow into mini forests.Gilvazio owns nursery beds for the different kinds of trees which he sells to different categories of people depending on their choice to earn income.
 
After facing a hard time generating income to meet his family and children's needs, he then put much emphasis on this project of planting and buying of trees around his home area. 
He hopes his family's standard of living will greatly improve in the near future since now he is comfortably able to take care of his family of eight children and his wife.
He thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the financial assistance rendered all this time.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Kdaf

texts.en:
Kdaf is a 26-year-old married man who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He works as cleaner in the public sector and earns a low salary. Kdaf is respectful man. He intends to buy construction supplies for his house, but the amount he has saved is not enough to buy what he needs. 

Kdaf is requesting a 70,000 YER youth loan from AMB to buy construction supplies to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to improve his living standards

loans.name: Shianda Group

texts.en:
Shianda Group is located in Kakamega South District. It is a group of 10 women and 2 men led by Catherine pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for ½ an acre of maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. Catherine first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Catherine joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for her family and to use the increased profits to send her children to school.

Catherine described her harvest as very good last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year. She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and assist the needy. Catherine’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total, they will receive inputs for 6 acres of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Balina Group

texts.en:
Hellen’s group has 12 farmers and is located in Kakamega South District. Hellen is pictured on the right of Balina Group with her hand raised. Hellen is pictured amongst the 3 men and 9 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Hellen first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2012 Long Rains season and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Hellen joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and access to the best input prices.

Hellen described her harvest as excellent last year as a One Acre Fund farmer and hopes for another good year in the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to send her children to school and invest in cows. During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive ½ an acre of agricultural inputs on credit. Hellen’s group will receive 6 acres worth of inputs on credit.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Msoso A Group

texts.en:
Lydia’s group has 20 farmers and is located in Kakamega South District. Lydia is pictured on the right of Msoso A Group with her hand raised. Lydia is pictured amongst the 3 men and 17 women of her group. She will receive input loans capable of planting ½ an acre with sorghum, millet, and maize. Lydia first enrolled with One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Lydia joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family and to have a better harvest.

Prior to joining One Acre Fund, Lydia was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize per ½ acre, but after joining One Acre Fund during the Long Rains 2012, she was able to harvest 5 bags per ½ acre! She hopes that her profits from the 2013 Long Rains season can be used to send her children to school and perhaps invest in another business. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Lydia’s group members will take input loans of ½ acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 10 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet and sorghum

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov's business is going well with thanks to her previous loan, which she used to purchase seasonal children's clothing. The diversified assortment of goods attracted more customers and thus, brought more profits to her business.

This time Lubov is asking for a loan to purchase Spring clothing for children and teenagers. Her considerable experience and low prices have enabled Lubov to gain many repeat clients, stable profits and hope for the future.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing to sell

loans.name: Fawzia

texts.en: Fawzia is a 41 year old woman.  She is a mother to four children, both sons and daughters. She sells clothes and towels from home to help her husband support the family. Fawzia is applying for a loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Musembe Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a member of Musembe Group in Kakamega South District. He is pictured with 10 One Acre Fund farmers, two women and eight men. Patrick is standing on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving a loan to cultivate 1/2 an acre of maize, millet, and sorghum. Patrick joined One Acre Fund during the 2011 Long Rains season and is now enrolling in the 2013 Long Rains season. Patrick joined One Acre Fund so that he could gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and specialize in modern production.

Patrick reports that before One Acre Fund, he was able to grow about 7 bags of maize per 1/2 acre, but with his One Acre Fund loan during Long Rains 2012, he harvested 9 bags per 1/2 acre. He plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to save for the future. For the 2013 Long Rains season, Patrick’s group members will take loans to cultivate 1/2 acre each. In total, this group will receive loans to use on 5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is the married parent of five children. She operates a business selling vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Edna works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her previous four loans from NWTF.

Edna is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to buy additional vegetables to sell. In the future, she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and support her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling rice in the Philippines. She has had her business for eight years, and also earns an income from raising chickens. Eleonor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Eleonor is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, she dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim is 40 years, deals in the maize trade, and also has a retail shop. He would like to get money to add stock to his business in order to make ends meet. 

His dream is to give his family a better life by taking his children to good schools, ensuring that they get the best education, as well as living in modest accommodations. 

His challenge is weather, and competition from people of the same business. He is hardworking and honest.

He is confident that the partnership will be maintained, since he promises to meet his repayments as scheduled. He is a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy a stock of beans and corn.
